entry.title: Efficient ReliK 1 Paper Reading
entry.content:
This is one of the two projects I undertake in 24 Fall semester, which is related to data mining.

Supervisor: Assoc. Prof. Davide Mottin, PhD Student Maximilian Egger.

Generally speaking, they have already developed a new method, ReliK, for measuring knowledge graph embeddings, but they want to speed it up with GPUs.

So my project is focusing on this. I wish to speed them up with some tolerance on small accuracy loss.

I need to first get familiar with the paper, ReliK: A Reliability Measure for Knowledge Graph Embedding. Here is some digest and notes from it.

Abstract

Object of ReliK: To assess a priori how well a knowledge graph embedding (KGE) will perform on a downstream task and in a specific part of the knowledge graph.

ReliK aka Reliability measure of KGEs.

  • It relies only on KGE embedding scores.
  • Task independent
  • KGE independent

Correlates well with some downstream tasks:

  • tail/relation prediction, triple classification
  • rule mining, question answering.

Introduction

KGE: generate a vector representation for entities and relationships of a KG.

Motivation: KEG method depends on which downstream task. We want to unified, global measure to quantify the reliability of KGE method.

Contributions: ReliK, principled measure that quantifies the reliability of how a KEG will perform will on a certain downstream task in a specific part of the KG without executing that task or training KG!!!

ReliK is based on the relative ranking of existing KG triples w.r.t. non-existing one.

Preliminaries

Knowledge Graph

KG K:⟨E,R,F⟩\mathcal K:\langle\mathcal E,\mathcal R,\mathcal F\rangleK:⟨E,R,F⟩ is a triple consisting of a set E\mathcal EE of nnn entities, a set R\mathcal RR of relationships, and a set F⊂E×R×E\mathcal F\subset\mathcal E\times\mathcal R\times\mathcal EF⊂E×R×E of mmm facts.

A fact is a triple xhrt=(h,r,t)x_{hrt}=(h,r,t)xhrt​=(h,r,t). head, relation, tail.

We say xhrtx_{hrt}xhrt​ is positive if it actually exists in the KG xhrt∈Fx_{hrt}\in\mathcal Fxhrt​∈F, negative otherwise xhrt∉Fx_{hrt}\not\in\mathcal Fxhrt​∈F.

Knowledge Graph Embedding

It is a representation of entities and relationships in a ddd-dimensional space, d≪∣E∣d\ll\vert\mathcal E\vertd≪∣E∣. The Rd\mathbb R^dRd or Cd\mathbb C^dCd space.

The embedding score: function s:E×R×E→Rs:\mathcal E\times\mathcal R\times\mathcal E\to\mathbb Rs:E×R×E→R, which quantifies how like a triple xhrtx_{hrt}xhrt​ exists in K\mathcal KK based on the embedding of its head, relationship, and tail.

  • Intuitively, the higher s(xhrt)s(x_{hrt})s(xhrt​), the more likely the existence of xhrtx_{hrt}xhrt​ in K\mathcal KK.

Key Reliability

Desideratum

  1. Embedding-agnostic. It is independent of the specific KGE method.
  2. Learning-free. No further KGE training.
  3. Task-agnostic. It is independent of downstream task.
  4. Locality. A good predictor of KGE performance locally to a given triple.

ReliK Measure

To fulfill 1. 2.: Treat embedding score as a black-box function that provides only an indication of the actual existence of a triple.

Use position of a triple via a ranking based on embedding score: Assume the relative ranking of a positive triple to be higher than that of negative.

For 4. locality, we assume that a local approach that consider triples relative to a neighborhood is more appropriate.

Definition

For a triple xhrt=(h,r,t)x_{hrt}=(h,r,t)xhrt​=(h,r,t) we compute the neighbor set N−(h)\mathcal N^-(h)N−(h) of all possible negative triples, that is triples with head hhh that do not exist in K\mathcal KK.

Similarly, we define N−(t)\mathcal N^-(t)N−(t) for tail.

Head rank: rankH(xhrt)=∣{x∈N−(h):s(x)>s(xhrt)}∣+1rank_H(x_{hrt})=|\{x\in\mathcal N^-(h):s(x)\gt s(x_{hrt})\}|+1rankH​(xhrt​)=∣{x∈N−(h):s(x)>s(xhrt​)}∣+1

Similarly, we define rankT(xhrt)rank_T(x_{hrt})rankT​(xhrt​) for tail.

ReliK(xhrt)=12(1rankH(xhrt)+1rankT(xhrt)).ReliK(x_{hrt})=\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{rank_H(x_{hrt})}+\frac{1}{rank_T(x_{hrt})}\right).ReliK(xhrt​)=21​(rankH​(xhrt​)1​+rankT​(xhrt​)1​).

ReliK can easily be extended from single triples to sub-graphs by computing the average reliability among the triples in the subgraph.

We define the ReliK score of a set S⊆FS\subseteq\mathcal FS⊆F of triples as

ReliK(S)=1S∑xhrt∈SReliK(xhrt).ReliK(S)=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{x_{hrt}\in S}ReliK(x_{hrt}).ReliK(S)=S1​xhrt​∈S∑​ReliK(xhrt​).

ReliK∈(0,1]ReliK\in(0,1]ReliK∈(0,1]. The higher the ReliKReliKReliK, the better reliability.

The lower the head-rank and tail-rank, the better the ranking of xhrtx_{hrt}xhrt​ induced by the underlying embedding scores.

Efficiently Computing ReliK

Computing original ReliK requires Ω(∣C∣⋅∣R∣)\Omega(|\mathcal C|\cdot|\mathcal R|)Ω(∣C∣⋅∣R∣), as it needs to scan the entire negative neighborhood of the target triple.

Computationally TOO HEAVY!!!

We thus propose approximate version of ReliK with efficiency.

Main intuition of approximation is that the precise ranking of many potential triples is not needed.

What it matters is just the number of those triples that exhibit a higher embedding score than the target triple.

Lower bound:

  • ReliKLBReliK_{LB}ReliKLB​, a lower bound to ReliKReliKReliK by counting the negative triples in the sample that have a lower embedding score.

Approximate

  • ReliKApxReliK_{Apx}ReliKApx​, estimation of ReliKReliKReliK by evaluating the fraction of triples in the sample that have a higher score than the triple under consideration and scaling this fraction to the total number of negative triples.

Let SHS_HSH​ be a random subset of kkk elements selected without replacement independently and uniformly at random from negative neighborhood N−(h)\mathcal N^-(h)N−(h) of the head hhh of a triple xhrtx_{hrt}xhrt​.

rankHS(xhrt)=∣{x∈SH:s(x)>s(xhrt)}∣+1,rank_H^S(x_{hrt})=\vert\{x\in S_H:s(x)\gt s(x_{hrt})\}\vert+1,rankHS​(xhrt​)=∣{x∈SH​:s(x)>s(xhrt​)}∣+1,

to be the rank of the score s(xhrt)s(x_{hrt})s(xhrt​) the KGE assigns to xhrtx_{hrt}xhrt​, among all the triples in the sample.

Similarly, we compute rankTSrank_T^SrankTS​ for tail’s neighborhood N−(t)\mathcal N^-(t)N−(t).

Lower Bound Estimator

rankH(xhrt)≤rankHS(xhrt)+∣N−(h)∣−∣SH∣rankT(xhrt)≤rankTS(xhrt)+∣N−(h)∣−∣ST∣⇒ReliKLB(xhrt)=12(1rankHS(xhrt)+∣N−(h)∣−∣SH∣+1rankTS(xhrt)+∣N−(t)∣−∣ST∣),rank_H(x_{hrt})\le rank_H^S(x_{hrt})+|\mathcal N^-(h)|-|S_H|\\rank_T(x_{hrt})\le rank_T^S(x_{hrt})+|\mathcal N^-(h)|-|S_T|\\\Rarr ReliK_{LB}(x_{hrt})=\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{rank_H^S(x_{hrt})+|\mathcal N^-(h)|-|S_H|}+\frac{1}{rank_T^S(x_{hrt})+|\mathcal N^-(t)|-|S_T|}\right),rankH​(xhrt​)≤rankHS​(xhrt​)+∣N−(h)∣−∣SH​∣rankT​(xhrt​)≤rankTS​(xhrt​)+∣N−(h)∣−∣ST​∣⇒ReliKLB​(xhrt​)=21​(rankHS​(xhrt​)+∣N−(h)∣−∣SH​∣1​+rankTS​(xhrt​)+∣N−(t)∣−∣ST​∣1​),

It holds that ReliKLB(xhrt)≤ReliK(xhrt)ReliK_{LB}(x_{hrt})\le ReliK(x_{hrt})ReliKLB​(xhrt​)≤ReliK(xhrt​).

Upper Bound Estimator

Theoretical analysis is omitted here.

ReliKApx(xhrt)=12(1rankHS(xhrt)N−(h)∣SH∣+1rankTS(xhrt)N−(t)∣ST∣).ReliK_{Apx}(x_{hrt})=\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{rank_H^S(x_{hrt})\frac{\mathcal N^-(h)}{|S_H|}}+\frac{1}{rank_T^S(x_{hrt})\frac{\mathcal N^-(t)}{|S_T|}}\right).ReliKApx​(xhrt​)=21​⎝⎛​rankHS​(xhrt​)∣SH​∣N−(h)​1​+rankTS​(xhrt​)∣ST​∣N−(t)​1​⎠⎞​.

Pseudo Code

Input: KG K:⟨E,R,F⟩\mathcal K:\langle\mathcal E,\mathcal R,\mathcal F\rangleK:⟨E,R,F⟩, triple xhrt=(h,r,t)∈Fx_{hrt}=(h,r,t)\in\mathcal Fxhrt​=(h,r,t)∈F, embedding score function s:E×R×E→Rs:\mathcal E\times\mathcal R\times\mathcal E\to\mathbb Rs:E×R×E→R, sample size k∈Nk\in\mathbb Nk∈N

Output: ReliKLB(xhrt)ReliK_{LB}(x_{hrt})ReliKLB​(xhrt​) or ReliKApx(xhrt)ReliK_{Apx}(x_{hrt})ReliKApx​(xhrt​)

  1. SH←S_H\getsSH​← sample kkk triples from N−(h)\mathcal N^-(h)N−(h); ST←S_T\getsST​← sample kkk triples from N−(t)N^-(t)N−(t).

  2. rankH←1rank_H\gets1rankH​←1; rankT←1rank_T\gets1rankT​←1

  3. for xh′r′t′∈SH∪STx_{h'r't'}\in S_H\cup S_Txh′r′t′​∈SH​∪ST​ do

    • If s(xhrt)≤s(xh′r′t′)s(x_{hrt})\le s(x_{h'r't'})s(xhrt​)≤s(xh′r′t′​) then

      • if h′=hh'=hh′=h then

        rankH←rankH+1rank_H\gets rank_H+1rankH​←rankH​+1

      • if t′=tt'=tt′=t then

        rankT←rankT+1rank_T\gets rank_T+1rankT​←rankT​+1

  4. return 12(1rankH+∣N−(h)∣−∣SH∣+1rankT+∣N−(t)∣−∣ST∣)\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{rank_H+|\mathcal N^-(h)|-|S_H|}+\frac{1}{rank_T+|\mathcal N^-(t)|-|S_T|}\right)21​(rankH​+∣N−(h)∣−∣SH​∣1​+rankT​+∣N−(t)∣−∣ST​∣1​) for ReliKLBReliK_{LB}ReliKLB​

    or 12(1rankHN−(h)∣SH∣+1rankTN−(t)∣ST∣)\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{rank_H\frac{\mathcal N^-(h)}{|S_H|}}+\frac{1}{rank_T\frac{\mathcal N^-(t)}{|S_T|}}\right)21​(rankH​∣SH​∣N−(h)​1​+rankT​∣ST​∣N−(t)​1​) for ReliKApxReliK_{Apx}ReliKApx​

Time Complexity

O(k)\mathcal O(k)O(k).

When k≈20%⋅nk\approx 20\%\cdot nk≈20%⋅n, 2.5X faster, mean square error = 0.002.

Experimental Evaluation

entry.title: 算法和计算复杂度 8 Branching Programs and Barrington’s Theorem
entry.content:
NC1⊆L/poly⊆NL/poly⊆AC1NC^1\subseteq L/poly\subseteq NL/poly\subseteq AC^1NC1⊆L/poly⊆NL/poly⊆AC1.

The model of branching programs that give a precise characterization of L/polyL/polyL/poly and NL/polyNL/polyNL/poly.

Deterministic / non-deterministic branching program

Boolean Branching Program

Deterministic

📖Definition 32. A Deterministic Boolean branching program BBB with nnn inputs consists of the following:

  • A directed acyclic graph D=(V,A)D=(V,A)D=(V,A), where the out-degree of all nodes is in {0,1,2}\{0,1,2\}{0,1,2}.
  • A partial labeling ℓV:V→{0,1,x1,⋯ ,xn}\ell_V:V\to\{0,1,x_1,\cdots,x_n\}ℓV​:V→{0,1,x1​,⋯,xn​} of the nodes of DDD.
  • A partial labeling ℓA:A→{0,1}\ell_A:A\to\{0,1\}ℓA​:A→{0,1} of the edges of DDD.
  • An initial node s∈Vs\in Vs∈V.

When node vvv is not labeled by ℓV\ell_VℓV​, we say that vvv is dummy.

If ℓV(v)∈{0,1}\ell_V(v)\in\{0,1\}ℓV​(v)∈{0,1}, we say that vvv is an output node.

The graph DDD and the labeling function ℓV,ℓA\ell_V,\ell_AℓV​,ℓA​ should satisfy:

  1. The node sss is not a dummy node.
  2. If ℓV(v)∈{x1,⋯ ,xn}\ell_V(v)\in\{x_1,\cdots,x_n\}ℓV​(v)∈{x1​,⋯,xn​}, the out-degree of vvv is 222, and one outgoing edges of vvv is labeled 000 and 111 by ℓA\ell_AℓA​ respectively.
  3. If ℓV(v)∈{0,1}\ell_V(v)\in\{0,1\}ℓV​(v)∈{0,1}, i.e., vvv is an output node, the out-degree of vvv is 000.
  4. If vvv is a dummy node, the in-degree of vvv is not 000, the out-degree of vvv is 111.

A branching program with nnn inputs compute a Boolean function f:{0,1}n→{0,1}f:\{0,1\}^n\to\{0,1\}f:{0,1}n→{0,1} in a natural way.

Given an input x∈{0,1}nx\in\{0,1\}^nx∈{0,1}n, start in the initial node sss, follow a path to an output node, thereby giving the value of f(x)f(x)f(x).

When passing through dummy node, directly go through the unique path.

When passing through labeled node, go to 111-labeled edge if xi=1x_i=1xi​=1, 000-labeled edge if xi=0x_i=0xi​=0.

Non-deterministic

Simply modify the deterministic branching program:

  • label of vertices is ℓV:V→{0,1,∗,x1,⋯ ,xn}\ell_V:V\to\{0,1,*,x_1,\cdots,x_n\}ℓV​:V→{0,1,∗,x1​,⋯,xn​}. If ℓV(v)=∗\ell_V(v)=*ℓV​(v)=∗, vvv is called a choice node.
  • We require the out-degree of vvv is 222 and outgoing edges are not labeled by ℓA\ell_AℓA​.

For a given input x∈{0,1}nx\in\{0,1\}^nx∈{0,1}n, traverse the branching program from sss, but at a choice node choose to follow an arbitrary arc.

We say that the non-deterministic branching program accepts xxx if there exist such choices leading the path to an output node labeled 111.

📖Definition 33. The size of a branching program is the number of nodes in the branching program. The length of a branching program is the length of the longest path from sss to a node to out degree 000.

Then define complexity classes of languages computed by size-bounded branching programs.

📖Definition 34. Let S:N→NS:\mathbb N\to\mathbb NS:N→N. BPSIZE(S(n))BPSIZE(S(n))BPSIZE(S(n)) is the class of languages computed by families of deterministic Boolean branching program of size O(S(n))O(S(n))O(S(n)). Similarly, NPBSIZE(S(n))NPBSIZE(S(n))NPBSIZE(S(n)) is the class of languages computed by families of non-deterministic Boolean branching program of size O(S(n))O(S(n))O(S(n)).

🤔Theorem 43. L/poly=BPSIZE(nO(1)),NL/poly=NBPSIZE(nO(1))L/poly=BPSIZE(n^{O(1)}),NL/poly=NBPSIZE(n^{O(1)})L/poly=BPSIZE(nO(1)),NL/poly=NBPSIZE(nO(1)).

🤔Theorem 44. L=UL−BPSIZE(nO(1)),NL=UL−NBPSIZE(nO(1))L=U_L-BPSIZE(n^{O(1)}),NL=U_L-NBPSIZE(n^{O(1)})L=UL​−BPSIZE(nO(1)),NL=UL​−NBPSIZE(nO(1)).

Programs over Monoids and Bounded Width Branching Programs

monoid 含幺半群

What if we restrict the width of branching programs?

Consider the width to be constant.

📖Definition 35. A branching program BBB is in layered form, if there is a partition of the nodes of BBB into layers V1,⋯ ,Vl,V=V1∪⋯∪VlV_1,\cdots ,V_l,V=V_1\cup\cdots\cup V_lV1​,⋯,Vl​,V=V1​∪⋯∪Vl​, in such a way that every edge go between some pair of adjacent layers ViV_iVi​ and Vi+1V_{i+1}Vi+1​.

📖Definition 36. The width of a branching program with partition into layers V=V1∪⋯∪VlV=V_1\cup\cdots\cup V_lV=V1​∪⋯∪Vl​ is the size of the largest layer, maxi∣Vi∣max_i|V_i|maxi​∣Vi​∣.

Then here comes new complexity classes.

📖Definition 37. BWBPBWBPBWBP is the class of languages computed by families of Boolean branching programs polynomial size and width O(1)O(1)O(1).

It’s easy to show AC0⊆BWBPAC^0\subseteq BWBPAC0⊆BWBP (❓)

Conjecture: MAJ∉BWBPMAJ\not\in BWBPMAJ∈BWBP.

Fact: BWBP=NC1BWBP=NC^1BWBP=NC1.

Consider computation over finite algebraic structures, finite groups.

📖Definition 38. A monoid is a set MMM closed under an associative binary operation s.t. MMM has an identity element:

  1. For all x,y∈Mx,y\in Mx,y∈M, we have xy∈Mxy\in Mxy∈M. 封闭性
  2. For all x,y,z∈Mx,y,z\in Mx,y,z∈M, we have x(yz)=(xy)zx(yz)=(xy)zx(yz)=(xy)z. 结合律
  3. There is an element 1∈M1\in M1∈M s.t. 1x=x1=x1x=x1=x1x=x1=x for all x∈Mx\in Mx∈M 含有幺元

The set of functions from a set SSS to itself which forms a monoid, denoted TST_STS​.

The set of partial functions from a set SSS to itself forms a monoid, denote PTSPT_SPTS​.

Commonsense: Any group is a monoid.

📖Definition 39. Let MMM be a finite monoid. A program PPP over MMM with nnn inputs consists of the following:

  1. A sequence I1,⋯ ,IlI_1,\cdots,I_lI1​,⋯,Il​ of triples of the form ⟨i,g0,g1⟩\langle i,g_0,g_1\rangle⟨i,g0​,g1​⟩, where i∈{1,⋯ ,n}i\in\{1,\cdots,n\}i∈{1,⋯,n} and g0,g1∈Mg_0,g_1\in Mg0​,g1​∈M.
  2. An accepting set A⊆MA\subseteq MA⊆M.

The triples is called instructions of the program PPP.

A program PPP over MMM with nnn inputs define a Boolean function f:{0,1}n→{0,1}f:\{0,1\}^n\to\{0,1\}f:{0,1}n→{0,1} in a natural way:

  • Let x∈{0,1}nx\in\{0,1\}^nx∈{0,1}n.
  • The output of an instruction I=⟨i,g0,g1⟩I=\langle i,g_0,g_1\rangleI=⟨i,g0​,g1​⟩ is given by I(x)=gxiI(x)=g_{x_i}I(x)=gxi​​.
  • The output of the program is P(x)=∏j=1lIj(x)P(x)=\prod_{j=1}^lI_j(x)P(x)=∏j=1l​Ij​(x).
  • Finally f(x)=1f(x)=1f(x)=1 iff P(x)∈AP(x)\in AP(x)∈A.

📖Definition 40. The length of a program PPP is the number of instructions of PPP.

🤔Proposition 10: Let fff be a Boolean function computed by a family of polynomial length programs over a finite monoid MMM. Then f∈NC1f\in NC^1f∈NC1.

🤔Proposition 11. BWBP⊆NC1BWBP\subseteq NC^1BWBP⊆NC1.

Barrington’s Theorem

Any language in NC1NC^1NC1 can be computed by polynomial size constant width branching programs.

Theorem 45 (Barrington’s Theorem). BWBP=NC1BWBP=NC^1BWBP=NC1.

By constructing polynomial length programs over group S5S_5S5​ of permutations of 555 elements.

The width is fixed 555.

We denote the identity permutation by e∈S5e\in S_5e∈S5​.

📖Definition 41. Let PPP be a program over S5S_5S5​ and let σ∈S5\sigma\in S_5σ∈S5​ be a 555-cycle. We say that PPP σ\sigmaσ-computes a Boolean function fff if P(x)=σP(x)=\sigmaP(x)=σ when f(x)=1f(x)=1f(x)=1 and P(x)=eP(x)=eP(x)=e when f(x)=0f(x)=0f(x)=0. We can also simply say that PPP 555-cycle computes fff.

🤔Lemma. Let σ\sigmaσ and τ\tauτ be 555-cycles. If a program PPP over S5S_5S5​ of length lll σ\sigmaσ-computes fff, then there is another program P′P'P′ of length lll over S5S_5S5​ that τ\tauτ-computes fff.

🤔Lemma. If a program PPP over S5S_5S5​ of length lll 555-cycle computes fff, then there is another program P′P'P′ of length lll that 555-cycle computes ¬f\neg f¬f.

📖Definition 42 (commutator 交换子). Let GGG be a group and g,h∈Gg,h\in Gg,h∈G. The commutator [g,h][g,h][g,h] is the element g−1h−1ghg^{-1}h^{-1}ghg−1h−1gh.

🤔Lemma. There exists 555-cycles σ1\sigma_1σ1​ and σ2\sigma_2σ2​ s.t. their commutator [σ1,σ2][\sigma_1,\sigma_2][σ1​,σ2​], is also a 555-cycle.

σ1=(1,2,3,4,5),σ2=(1,3,5,4,2).\sigma_1=(1,2,3,4,5),\sigma_2=(1,3,5,4,2).σ1​=(1,2,3,4,5),σ2​=(1,3,5,4,2).

[σ1,σ2]=(1,2,5,3,4)[\sigma_1,\sigma_2]=(1,2,5,3,4)[σ1​,σ2​]=(1,2,5,3,4)

🤔Proposition 12. Let CCC be a fanin 222 circuit of depth ddd. Then there exist a program PPP of length at most 4d4^d4d that 555-cycle computes the output of CCC.

By Proposition 11 and 12, we obtain Barrington’s Theorem.

entry.title: 丹麦语 DU 3.3 3 Sammenligning af forskellige kulturer
entry.content:
Sammenligninger

sammenligning -en, -er, -erne 比较

Sammenligninger i 1. grad

原级比较

  • ikke så … som

    Eks: Tom er ikke så høj som Mads. 汤姆没有梅兹高。Tom ist nicht so groß wie Mads.

  • lige så … som

    Eks: Poul er lige så høj som Mads. 汤姆和梅兹一样高。Poul ist so groß wie Mads.

  • lige … (-e)

    Eks: Poul og Mads er lige høje. 汤姆和梅兹一样高。Poul und Mads sind gleich groß.

Sammenligninger i 2. grad

比较级比较

  • -(e)re end

    Eks: Poul er højere end Tom.

  • mere … end

    Eks: Tom er mere sporty end Poul.

  • mindre … end

    Eks: Poul er mindre sporty end Tom.

Sammenligninger i 3. grad

最高级比较

  • -(e)st

    Eks: Poul og Mads er højest.

  • mest …

    Eks: Tom er mest sporty.

  • mindst …

    Eks: Mads er mindst sporty.

⚠️I 1. grad er der tre former af adjektivet: n-form, t-form og e-form

Praktiske dialoger

At bede nogen gøre noget

  • Kan jeg ikke få dig til at … 我能让你去做……吗？

    svar: Jo, prøv at se her!

  • Vil I ikke være søde at … 请做……，好吗？

    svar: Jo, selvfølgelig.

  • Vil I ikke godt prøve at … 你不争取/尝试做……吗？

    svar: Jo, det skal vi nok.

  • Gider du ikke lige prøve at … 难道你不想尝试……吗？

    svar: Nej, det ser o.k. ud. （否定回答）

At bede om accept

  • Har du noget imod, at …? 你介意如果……吗？

    svar: Nej, det er helt i orden. 不介意，完全没问题。

  • Er det i orden, at …? 可以……吗？

    svar: Ja, gør bare det. 可以，就这么做吧。

At bede nogen om ikke at …

  • Der er ikke så godt, at … ……这不太好。

  • Vil I ikke godt lade være med at …? 能不能麻烦你停止做……？

    svar: Jo, undskyld.

Faste udtryk

积累一些 动词-介词 固定搭配

  • har svært ved … 在……方面有困难
  • er sikker på … 确信……
  • har mulighed for … 有……的机会/可能
  • regner med … 指望……
  • er opsat på … 决心……
  • har problemer med … 在……方面有问题
  • tænker på … 想着……
  • har besluttet sig for … 决定了……
  • er enige om … 在……方面意见一致
  • glæder sig til … 期待……
  • har planer om … 计划……
  • har ikke råd til … 买不起……
  • er i gang med … 正在做……
  • er god til … 擅长……
  • er interesseret i … 对……感兴趣
  • fortsætter med … 继续……
  • er optaget af … 忙于……
  • har holdt op med … 停止……
  • har travlt med … 忙于……
  • er nødt til … 不得不……
  • har ansvar for … 对……负责
  • er færdige med … 完成……
  • er vant til … 习惯于……
  • hjælper med … 帮助做……
  • trænger til … 需要……
  • er træt af … 厌倦了……
  • har lyst til … 想要……
  • er bange for … 害怕……
  • er ked af … 为……感到难过
  • har brug for … 需要
  • er glad for … 为……感到高兴
  • er irriteret over … 为……感到恼火
  • er bekymret for … 为……担心
  • er ligeglad med … 对……漠不关心
  • har fortalt meget om … 告诉了很多关于……的事
  • er venlig mod … 对……很友善
  • er afhængig af … 依赖……
  • er overrasket over … 对……感到惊讶
  • har respekt for … 尊重……
  • er tilfreds med … 对……感到满意
  • er skuffet over … 对……感到失望
  • stoler på … 信任……
  • klager over … 抱怨……
  • har tillid til … 信任……
  • er flinke mod … 对……很友好
  • tager hensyn til … 顾及……
  • interesserer sig for … 对……感兴趣
  • er grove mod … 对……很粗鲁
  1. 部分固定搭配可以加某事（名词、代词），尤其是那些描述机会，问题或情感的表达。
  2. 部分固定搭配可以加某人，通常表达人与人之间的情感或态度的短语。
  3. 很多情况下，固定搭配后面会跟 at + 动词不定式。

口语表达练习 Mit møde med dansk kultur

Jeg oplevede dansk kultur for første gang, da jeg kom til Danmark for at studere. Jeg har lagt mærke til flere forskelle og ligheder mellem Danmark og mit hjemland. For eksempel bruger man i mit hjemland ofte ‘De’, når man taler med ældre eller folk, man ikke kender godt. I Danmark siger man bare ‘du’ til alle, og det gør, at folk føler sig mere lige. Det synes jeg er meget spændende.

En anden stor forskel er tillid. I Danmark stoler folk meget på hinanden. Man ser ofte, at folk efterlader deres ting udenfor, uden at være bange for, at de bliver stjålet. I mit hjemland er vi mere forsigtige, fordi vi ikke har samme tillid. Jeg synes, det er godt, at der er så meget tillid her.

Noget andet, jeg har lagt mærke til, er måden, danskerne kommunikerer på. I mit hjemland bruger vi ofte meget kropssprog, mens danskerne er mere rolige. Men de siger, hvad de mener, og det kan være lidt overraskende i starten. Jeg har også lært, at lighed er meget vigtigt i Danmark. Både mænd og kvinder deler husarbejde og børnepasning, hvilket er anderledes fra mit hjemland.

Hygge er også noget, der er meget typisk dansk. Det handler om at skabe en hyggelig og afslappet stemning, ofte med venner og familie. I mit hjemland er socialisering mere højlydt og aktiv, så hygge har været en ny oplevelse for mig. Men jeg kan godt lide det.

Til sidst har jeg lagt mærke til, at danskerne ikke altid er så gode til at tale om problemer. De vil hellere undgå konflikter, hvilket er noget, jeg har skullet vænne mig til. Men jeg synes, det er godt, at danskerne går op i tolerance og respekt for hinanden. Alle bliver behandlet på samme måde, og det er noget, jeg virkelig har lært at sætte pris på.

entry.title: Fair AI/ML 0 Overview
entry.content:
This semester, I will do a project again with Iannis.

I took some time to review the tutorial Fairness in AI/ML via Social Choice by Evi Micha & Nisarg Shah.

Social Choice Theory: Aggregating individual preferences into “good” collective decisions

Fairness in Social Choice

很熟悉了，可以快速掠过。

⚠️这里考虑的是 DIVISIBLE ITEMS.

EF, PROP

Fair division: Agents NNN, divisible resources MMM, utility function uiu_iui​.

Non-negative utilities (good), non-positive utilities (chores).

Proportionality, envy-freeness.

The Core

A core is a subset of agents, among which they can redistribute their entitlements.

But redistributed entitlements shouldn’t be a Pareto improvement.

2 types of the core

  1. Resource-scaling version

    No group of agents SSS should be able to find any allocation BBB of their proportionally entitled share of the resources that is Pareto improvement.

    ∄S⊆N,∣S∣∣N∣⋅M→B:ui(Bi)>ui(Ai)∀i∈S\not\exist S\subseteq N,\frac{|S|}{|N|}\cdot M\to B:u_i(B_i)\gt u_i(A_i)\forall i\in S∃S⊆N,∣N∣∣S∣​⋅M→B:ui​(Bi​)>ui​(Ai​)∀i∈S

  2. Utility-scaling version

    No group of agents SSS should be able to find any allocation BBB of the resources that is a Pareto improvement even after proportional utility-scaling.

    ∄S⊆N,M→B:∣S∣∣N∣⋅ui(Bi)>ui(Ai)∀i∈S\not\exist S\subseteq N,M\to B:\frac{|S|}{|N|}\cdot u_i(B_i)\gt u_i(A_i)\forall i\in S∃S⊆N,M→B:∣N∣∣S∣​⋅ui​(Bi​)>ui​(Ai​)∀i∈S

  • Two versions are equivalent for some setting.
  • They are different when utilities are not linear additive.
  • If there is no scalable resource, there is no way to define resource-scaling version. But it is more appealing.

Nash Social Welfare

NSW is geometric mean of agent utilities.

NSW(A)=(∏i∈Nui(Ai))1/∣N∣NSW(A)=\left(\prod_{i\in N}u_i(A_i)\right)^{1/|N|}NSW(A)=(i∈N∏​ui​(Ai​))1/∣N∣

There are some other welfare functions:

  • Utilitarian social welfare: USW(A)=1∣N∣⋅∑i∈Nui(Ai)USW(A)=\frac{1}{|N|}\cdot\sum_{i\in N}u_i(A_i)USW(A)=∣N∣1​⋅∑i∈N​ui​(Ai​)

    为什么要起这么怪的名字，叫 average social welfare 不好嘛！

  • Egalitarian social welfare: ESW(A)=min⁡i∈Nui(Ai)ESW(A)=\min_{i\in N}u_i(A_i)ESW(A)=mini∈N​ui​(Ai​)

    明明可以叫 least social welfare 的……

🤔Theorem [Varian '74]: Any allocation maximizing NSW is envy-free in the core.

🤔Theorem [Orlin '10]: An allocation maximizing the NSW can be computed in strongly polynomial time.

Application of Core: Committee Selection

There are set of voters NNN, set of candidates MMM.

Each agent iii approves a subset of candidates Ai⊆MA_i\subseteq MAi​⊆M.

  • The utility for each voter is defined as the number of intersection of committee member and its approval.

    ui(W)=∣W∩Ai∣u_i(W)=|W\cap A_i|ui​(W)=∣W∩Ai​∣

  • The goal is to find W⊆MW\subseteq MW⊆M with ∣W∣≤k|W|\le k∣W∣≤k with given kkk.

WWW is in the core if there is no S⊆NS\subseteq NS⊆N and T⊆MT\subseteq MT⊆M with ∣T∣≤∣S∣∣N∣⋅k|T|\le\frac{|S|}{|N|}\cdot k∣T∣≤∣N∣∣S∣​⋅k (Here the candidates are resources, so its resource-scaling version) s.t. ui(T)>ui(W)∀i∈Su_i(T)\gt u_i(W)\forall i\in Sui​(T)>ui​(W)∀i∈S.

Advantages

It’s broadly defined

  • It often depends only on the definition of AGENTS and PREFERENCES.
  • Applicable to any setting as long as you define these two pieces of information.

Notions such as the core achieve group fairness to all possible groups.

  • No need to pre-specify the groups.
  • scale automatically with group size and cohesiveness, without additional parameters.

Envy-Freeness in ML

Classification

The model

  • Population of individuals given by a distribution DDD over XXX.

    individual iii represent data point xi∈Xx_i\in Xxi​∈X.

  • Classifier f:X→Yf:X\to Yf:X→Y maps every individual to a classification outcome

Types of classification:

  • Hard binary
  • Hard multi-class
  • Soft binary
  • Soft multi-class

Objective: minimize loss function

Utility function should be somehow related to loss function.

How to measure fairness in ML?

Individual Fairness

[Dwork, Hardt, Pitassi, Reingold, Zemel, 2012]

Similar individuals should be treated similarly

Classifier fff is individual fair if

∀x,y∈N,D(f(x),f(y))≤d(x,y)\forall x,y\in N,D(f(x),f(y))\le d(x,y)∀x,y∈N,D(f(x),f(y))≤d(x,y)

Envy-Freeness

[Balcan, Dick, Noothigattu, Procaccia, 2019]

Equal individuals shouldn’t envy each other.

Classifier fff is envy-free if

∀x,y∈N,ux(f(x))≥ux(f(y))\forall x,y\in N,u_x(f(x))\ge u_x(f(y))∀x,y∈N,ux​(f(x))≥ux​(f(y))

Envy-freeness is too strong for deterministic classifiers

  • loss of optimal deterministic EF classifier ≥1\ge1≥1.
  • Loss of optimal randomized EF classifier ≤1/γ\le1/\gamma≤1/γ.

一直没看懂这一部分在讲个啥

Preference-Informed IF

[Kim, Korolova, Rothblum, Yona, 2019]

Similar individuals shouldn’t envy each other too much.

Classifier is PIIF if

\forall x,y\in N,\exist z\in Y,D(z,f(y))\le d(x,y)\and u_x(f(x))\ge u_x(z).

Approximate EF

Equal individuals shouldn’t envy each other too much.

Classifier fff is approximately EF if ∀x,y∈N,ux(f(x))≥ux(f(y))−ϵ\forall x,y\in N,u_x(f(x))\ge u_x(f(y))-\epsilon∀x,y∈N,ux​(f(x))≥ux​(f(y))−ϵ.

OR

Classifier fff is approximately EF if ∀x,y∈N,ux(f(x))≥ux(f(y))−d(x,y)\forall x,y\in N,u_x(f(x))\ge u_x(f(y))-d(x,y)∀x,y∈N,ux​(f(x))≥ux​(f(y))−d(x,y)

Average Group Envy-Freeness

Equal groups shouldn’t envy-each other too much on average.

Classifier fff is approximately average group EF w.r.t. groups G1,G2G_1,G_2G1​,G2​ if

Ex∼G1,y∼G2[ux(f(y))−ux(f(x))]≤0\mathbb E_{x\sim G_1,y\sim G_2}[u_x(f(y))-u_x(f(x))]\le 0Ex∼G1​,y∼G2​​[ux​(f(y))−ux​(f(x))]≤0

Applicable for decision-making with limited resources

  • e.g. deciding on loan or bail applications
  • envy can not be prevented

Can be imposed for several pairs of groups simultaneously

Recommendations

[Do, Corbett-Davies, Atif, Usunier, 2023]

Model

  • Individuals represented by data points in set XXX
  • A set items YYY
  • A set of contexts CCC

Recommendation policy π\piπ

  • πx(y∣c)\pi_x(y|c)πx​(y∣c) is probability of recommending item yyy to user xxx given a context ccc.

Utility function: ux(πx)=Ec∼Cm,y∼πx(⋅∣c)[vx(y∣c)]u_x(\pi_x)=\mathbb E_{c\sim C_m,y\sim\pi_x(\cdot|c)}[v_x(y|c)]ux​(πx​)=Ec∼Cm​,y∼πx​(⋅∣c)​[vx​(y∣c)].

Envy-freeness: ∀x,x′∈X,ux(πx)≥ux(πx′)−ϵ\forall x,x'\in X,u_x(\pi_x)\ge u_x(\pi_{x'})-\epsilon∀x,x′∈X,ux​(πx​)≥ux​(πx′​)−ϵ

Two-Sided Fairness

为什么是 two-sided 呢？因为可以给用户定义效用函数，也可以给要推荐的商品定义效用函数。

[Biswas, Patro, Ganguly, Gummadi, Chakraborty, 2023]

Many-to-many matching

  • each user is recommended kkk products
  • each product may be recommended to a different number of users

Relevance of products to users given by V:X×Y→RV:X\times Y\to\mathbb RV:X×Y→R

Recommendation policy π\piπ

  • Each user xxx is recommended πx⊆Y\pi_x\subseteq Yπx​⊆Y with ∣πx∣=k|\pi_x|=k∣πx​∣=k
  • Let Yx∗Y_x^*Yx∗​ be the top-k products for user xxx by relevance

Utilities

  • Utility to user xxx given by ux(πx)=∑y∈πxV(x,y)∑y∈πx∗V(x,y)u_x(\pi_x)=\frac{\sum_{y\in\pi_x}V(x,y)}{\sum_{y\in\pi_x^*}V(x,y)}ux​(πx​)=∑y∈πx∗​​V(x,y)∑y∈πx​​V(x,y)​
  • Utility to product yyy given by Ey(π)E_y(\pi)Ey​(π), the number of users yyy is exposed to

Two-sided fairness

  • Fairness for users: EF1

    ∀x,x′∈X,∃y∈πx′:ux(πx)≥ux(πx′╲{y})\forall x,x'\in X,\exist y\in\pi_{x'}:u_x(\pi_x)\ge u_x(\pi_{x'}\diagdown\{y\})∀x,x′∈X,∃y∈πx′​:ux​(πx​)≥ux​(πx′​╲{y})

  • Fairness for products: minimum exposure E‾\overline EE

    ∀y∈Y,Ey(π)≥E‾\forall y\in Y,E_y(\pi)\ge\overline E∀y∈Y,Ey​(π)≥E

Theorem: There exists an efficient algorithm that achieves EF1 among all users and the minimum exposure guarantee among at least m−km-km−k products.

Non-Centroid Clustering

[Ahmadi, Awasthi, Khuller, Kleindessner, Morgenstern, Sukprasert, Vakilian, 2022]

[Aamand, Chen, Liu, Silwal, Sukprasert, Vakilian, Zhang, 2023]

Goal: Partition the agents into kkk clusters, i.e., C=(C1,⋯ ,Ck)C=(C_1,\cdots,C_k)C=(C1​,⋯,Ck​)

Model

  • Set of agents NNN partitioned into C=(C1,⋯ ,Ck)C=(C_1,\cdots,C_k)C=(C1​,⋯,Ck​).
  • Cluster containing agent iii denoted by C(i)C(i)C(i).
  • Distance metric d:N×N→R≥0d:N\times N\to\mathbb R_{\ge 0}d:N×N→R≥0​.

α\alphaα-EF: For each i∈Ni\in Ni∈N and j∈[k]j\in[k]j∈[k] with i∉Cji\not\in C_ji∈Cj​: either C(i)=iC(i)=iC(i)=i or

1∣C(i)∣−1∑i′∈C(i)d(i,i′)≤α∣Cj∣∑i′∈Cjd(i,i′)\frac{1}{|C(i)|-1}\sum_{i'\in C(i)}d(i,i')\le\frac{\alpha}{|C_j|}\sum_{i'\in C_j}d(i,i')∣C(i)∣−11​i′∈C(i)∑​d(i,i′)≤∣Cj​∣α​i′∈Cj​∑​d(i,i′)

Theorem:

A 1-envy-free clustering does not always exist, but an O(1)O(1)O(1)-envy-free clustering always exist and can be computed efficiently.

Another Setting

[Li, M, Nikolov, S, 2023]

Model

  • Set of agents NNN partitioned into C=(C1,⋯ ,Ck)C=(C_1,\cdots,C_k)C=(C1​,⋯,Ck​).
  • Cluster containing agent iii denoted by C(i)C(i)C(i).
  • Binary costs d:N×N→{0,1}d:N\times N\to\{0,1\}d:N×N→{0,1}

Theorem: There exists a balanced clustering (satisfying ∣C(i)∣=∣C(j)∣±1∀i,j|C(i)|=|C(j)|\pm1\forall i,j∣C(i)∣=∣C(j)∣±1∀i,j) s.t. for all i∈Ni\in Ni∈N and j∈[k]j\in[k]j∈[k], ∑i′∈C(i)d(i,i′)≤∑i′∈Cjd(i,i′)+O~(n/k)\sum_{i'\in C(i)}d(i,i')\le\sum_{i'\in C_j}d(i,i')+\tilde O(\sqrt{n/k})∑i′∈C(i)​d(i,i′)≤∑i′∈Cj​​d(i,i′)+O~(n/k​).

  • If we divide by the size of the clusters, then the additive term becomes o(1)o(1)o(1).

Nash Social Welfare in ML

Multi-Armed Bandits

多臂赌博机，遗憾最小化算法

kkk arms, μ1,μ2,⋯ ,μk\mu_1,\mu_2,\cdots,\mu_kμ1​,μ2​,⋯,μk​, μ∗=arg⁡max⁡j∈[k]μj\mu^*=\arg\max_{j\in[k]}\mu_jμ∗=argmaxj∈[k]​μj​.

Exploration vs Exploitation

Regret RT=Tμ∗−∑t=1Tμ(t)R_T=T_{\mu^*}-\sum_{t=1}^T\mu(t)RT​=Tμ∗​−∑t=1T​μ(t)

Multi-Agent Multi-Armed Bandits

[Hossain, M, S, 2021]

Agents NNN

Each arm j∈[k]j\in[k]j∈[k] for each agent i∈Ni\in Ni∈N have different data distribution μij\mu_{ij}μij​.

For each agent μi∗=arg⁡max⁡j∈[k]μij\mu_i^*=\arg\max_{j\in[k]}\mu_{ij}μi∗​=argmaxj∈[k]​μij​.

❓What is a fair policy?

Distribution p=[p1,⋯ ,pk]p=[p_1,\cdots,p_k]p=[p1​,⋯,pk​] gives expected reward ∑j=1kpj⋅μij\sum_{j=1}^kp_j\cdot\mu_{ij}∑j=1k​pj​⋅μij​ to agent iii

Maximizing welfare functions

  1. Utilitarian welfare ∑i=1n∑j=1kpj⋅μij\sum_{i=1}^n\sum_{j=1}^kp_j\cdot\mu_{ij}∑i=1n​∑j=1k​pj​⋅μij​
  2. Egalitarian welfare min⁡i∈N∑j=1kpj⋅μij\min_{i\in N}\sum_{j=1}^kp_j\cdot\mu_{ij}mini∈N​∑j=1k​pj​⋅μij​
  3. Nash welfare ∏i=1n∑j=1kpj⋅μij\prod_{i=1}^n\sum_{j=1}^kp_j\cdot\mu_{ij}∏i=1n​∑j=1k​pj​⋅μij​

Regret: RT=NSW(p∗,μ)−∑t=1TNSW(p(t),μ)R_T=NSW(p^*,\mu)-\sum_{t=1}^TNSW(p(t),\mu)RT​=NSW(p∗,μ)−∑t=1T​NSW(p(t),μ)

🤔Theorem: A variation of UCB achieves the optimal Θ(T)\Theta(\sqrt T)Θ(T​) regret.

Fair Exploration

[Barman, Khan, Maiti, Sawarni, 2023]

Agent ttt arrives at time ttt

We chose distribution PtP_tPt​, which gives the agent utility Ej∼Pt[μj]E_{j\sim P_t}[\mu_j]Ej∼Pt​​[μj​]

Regret: RT=μ∗−(∏t=1TEj∼Pt[μj])1/TR_T=\mu^*-(\prod_{t=1}^TE_{j\sim P_t}[\mu_j])^{1/T}RT​=μ∗−(∏t=1T​Ej∼Pt​​[μj​])1/T

Theorem: A variation of UCB achieves near-optimal regret in terms of TTT.

[Baek, Farias, 2021]

Agent ttt arrives at time ttt and belongs to group gtg_tgt​, where gt=gg_t=ggt​=g with probability pgp_gpg​

Policy: choose arm ata_tat​ at time ttt

Regret for group g:uTg(π)=∑t∈[T]:gt=g(μ∗−μat)g:u_T^g(\pi)=\sum_{t\in[T]:g_t=g}(\mu^*-\mu_{a_t})g:uTg​(π)=∑t∈[T]:gt​=g​(μ∗−μat​​)

Utility to group g:ug(π)=RTg(π0)−RTg(π)g:u^g(\pi)=R_T^g(\pi^0)-R_T^g(\pi)g:ug(π)=RTg​(π0)−RTg​(π), where π0\pi^0π0 is the policy minimizing the overall regret

Nash social welfare: NSW(π)=∏gug(π)NSW(\pi)=\prod_gu^g(\pi)NSW(π)=∏g​ug(π)

Theorem: A version of UCB exactly optimizes NSW.

Core in ML

Federated Learning

[Chaudhury, Li, Kang, Li, Mehta, 2022]

FL: Choose fθ:Rd→Rf_\theta:\mathbb R^d\to\mathbb Rfθ​:Rd→R from F={fθ:θ∈P⊆Rd}F=\{f_\theta:\theta\in P\subseteq\mathbb R^d\}F={fθ​:θ∈P⊆Rd}

Utility of each agent: ui(θ)=M−E(x,y)∼Di[ℓ(fθ(x),y)]u_i(\theta)=M-\mathbb E_{(x,y)\sim D_i}[\ell(f_\theta(x),y)]ui​(θ)=M−E(x,y)∼Di​​[ℓ(fθ​(x),y)]

Goal: Choose θ\thetaθ that is fair for all agents

Core: A parameter vector θ∈P\theta\in Pθ∈P is in the core if for all θ′∈P\theta'\in Pθ′∈P and S⊆NS\subseteq NS⊆N, it holds

ui(θ)≥∣S∣∣N∣ui(θ′)∀i∈S,u_i(\theta)\ge\frac{|S|}{|N|}u_i(\theta')\forall i\in S,ui​(θ)≥∣N∣∣S∣​ui​(θ′)∀i∈S,

with at least one strict inequality.

Pareto Optimality

Proportionality

🤔Theorem: When the agents’ utilities are continuous and the set of maximizer of any conical combination of the agents’ utilities is convex, a parameter vector θ∈P\theta\in Pθ∈P in the core always exists.

🤔Theorem: When the agents’ utilities are concave, then the parameter vector θ∈P\theta\in Pθ∈P that maximizes the NEW is in the core:

maximize ∏i∈Nui(θ) subject to θ∈Pmaximize ∑i∈Nlog⁡(ui(θ)) subject to θ∈P\text{maximize }\prod_{i\in N}u_i(\theta)\text{ subject to }\theta\in P\\\text{maximize }\sum_{i\in N}\log(u_i(\theta))\text{ subject to }\theta\in Pmaximize i∈N∏​ui​(θ) subject to θ∈Pmaximize i∈N∑​log(ui​(θ)) subject to θ∈P

Clustering

In ML

Goal: Analyze datasets to summarize their characteristics

Objects in the same group are similar

In Economics

Goal: Allocate a set of facilities that serve a set of agents. (e.g. hospital)

Centroid Clustering

Input

  • Set NNN of nnn data points
  • Set MMM of mmm feasible cluster centers
  • ∀i,j∈N∪M\forall i,j\in N\cup M∀i,j∈N∪M: we have d(i,j)d(i,j)d(i,j) which forms a Metric Space
    • d(i,i)=0∀i∈N∪Md(i,i)=0\forall i\in N\cup Md(i,i)=0∀i∈N∪M
    • d(i,j)=d(j,i)∀i,j∈N∪Md(i,j)=d(j,i)\forall i,j\in N\cup Md(i,j)=d(j,i)∀i,j∈N∪M
    • d(i,j)≤d(i,k)+d(k,j)∀i,j,k∈N∪Md(i,j)\le d(i,k)+d(k,j)\forall i,j,k\in N\cup Md(i,j)≤d(i,k)+d(k,j)∀i,j,k∈N∪M

Output

  • A set C⊆MC\subseteq MC⊆M of kkk centers
  • Each data points is assigned to its closest cluster center C(i)=arg⁡min⁡c∈Cd(i,c)C(i)=\arg\min_{c\in C}d(i,c)C(i)=argminc∈C​d(i,c)

Some Objective Functions

kkk-median: minimizes the sum of the distances

kkk-means: minimizes the sum of the square of the distances

kkk-center: minimizes the maximum distance

Fairness in Clustering

[Chen, Fain, Lyu, Munagala, 2019]

Fair clustering through proportional entitlement

  • Every group of n/kn/kn/k agents deserves its own cluster center

Definition in Committee Selection: WWW is the core if

  • For all S⊆NS\subseteq NS⊆N and T⊆MT\subseteq MT⊆M

  • If ∣S∣≥∣T∣⋅n/k|S|\ge|T|\cdot n/k∣S∣≥∣T∣⋅n/k, then ∣Ai∩W∣≥∣Ai∩T∣|A_i\cap W|\ge|A_i\cap T|∣Ai​∩W∣≥∣Ai​∩T∣ for some i∈Si\in Si∈S

    “If a group can afford TTT, then TTT should not be a strict Pareto improvement for the group”

Definition in Clustering: CCC is in the core if

  • For all S⊆NS\subseteq NS⊆N and y⊆My\subseteq My⊆M

  • If ∣S∣≥n/k|S|\ge n/k∣S∣≥n/k, then d(i,C(i))≤d(i,y)d(i,C(i))\le d(i,y)d(i,C(i))≤d(i,y) for some i∈Si\in Si∈S

    “If a group can afford a center yyy, then yyy should not be a strict Pareto improvement for the group”

Core in Centroid Clustering

[Chen, Fain, Lyu, Munagala, 2019]

A clustering solution in the core does not always exist

Approximation core

α\alphaα-core: A solution CCC is in the α\alphaα-core with α≥1\alpha\ge1α≥1 if there is no group of points S⊆NS\subseteq NS⊆N with ∣S∣≥n/k|S|\ge n/k∣S∣≥n/k and y∈My\in My∈M s.t.

∀i∈S,α⋅d(i,y)<d(i,C(i))\forall i\in S,\alpha\cdot d(i,y)\lt d(i,C(i))∀i∈S,α⋅d(i,y)<d(i,C(i))

🤔Theorem. There exists an algorithm Greedy Capture that returns a clustering solution in the (1+2)(1+\sqrt2)(1+2​)-core under any metric space. For arbitrary metric spaces and α<2\alpha\lt 2α<2, a clustering solution in the α\alphaα-core is not guaranteed to exist.

🤔Theorem.

  • For L2L_2L2​, Greedy Capture returns a solution in the 222-core
  • For L1L_1L1​ and L∞L_\inftyL∞​, GC does not always return a (<1+2)(\lt1+\sqrt2)(<1+2​)-core
  • For L2L_2L2​ and α<1.154\alpha<1.154α<1.154, a clustering solution in the α\alphaα-core is not guaranteed to exist
  • For L1L_1L1​ and L∞L_\inftyL∞​, and α<1.4\alpha\lt1.4α<1.4, a clustering solution in the α\alphaα-core is not guaranteed to exist

Core in Non-Centroid Clustering

Non-Centroid Clustering

  • Partition the individuals into kkk clusters
  • loss for each cluster: for S⊆NS\subseteq NS⊆N and i∈S,ℓi(S)≥0i\in S,\ell_i(S)\ge0i∈S,ℓi​(S)≥0.

α\alphaα-core: A solution CCC is in the α\alphaα-core with α≥1\alpha\ge1α≥1, if there is no group of points S⊆NS\subseteq NS⊆N with ∣S∣≥n/k|S|\ge n/k∣S∣≥n/k s.t.

∀i∈S,ℓi(S)<ℓi(C(i))\forall i\in S,\ell_i(S)\lt\ell_i(C(i))∀i∈S,ℓi​(S)<ℓi​(C(i))

Average loss: for each S⊆N,ℓi(S)=1∣S∣∑i′∈Sd(i,i′)S\subseteq N,\ell_i(S)=\frac{1}{|S|}\sum_{i'\in S}d(i,i')S⊆N,ℓi​(S)=∣S∣1​∑i′∈S​d(i,i′)

🤔Theorem

  • Greedy Capture returns a clustering solution in the (n/k)(n/k)(n/k)-core under any metric space
  • For arbitrary metric space and α<1.366\alpha\lt1.366α<1.366, a clustering solution in the α\alphaα-core is not guaranteed to exist

Open question: Does a clustering solution in the O(1)O(1)O(1)-core always exist?

entry.title: 丹麦语 DU 3.3 2 Normer og uskrevne regler
entry.content:
Høflighed og nedtoning

降低语气，表礼貌委婉

Generalisering: Danskerne er svære at komme i kontakt med.

  1. kan: Danskerne kan være svære at komme i kontakt med. 情态动词 kan 在此处表示一种可能性，不绝对。
  2. mange/nogle/en del/de fleste: Nogle danskerne er svære at komme i kontakt med. 定量表达：并不是所有（人）怎么怎么样。
  3. ofte/tit/normalt/nogle gange: Danskerne er nogle gange svære at komme i kontakt med. 频率副词：并不是 100% 会发生。
  4. vist/nok: Danskerne er vist svære at komme i kontakt med. 表示不确定的副词：可能、大概
  5. lidt/ret: Danskerne er lidt svære at komme i kontakt med. 表示程度的副词：有点、相当

这些东西可以组合在一起，比如：

  • Nogle danskerne kan være lidt svære at komme i kontakt med.
  • Danskerne kan vist nogle gange være en lille smule svære at komme i kontakt med. 丹麦人可能有时候有一点难以联系。

en lille smule 有一点

对于否定句 ikke 也有类似降低语气的表达

Generalisering: Danskerne er ikke nemme at komme i kontakt med.

  • Danskerne er ikke så nemme at komme i kontakt med.
  • Danskerne er vist ikke altid så nemme at komme i kontakt med.

støje -r, -de, -t 发出噪音

besværlig adj. 麻烦的

Om forholdet til tid

Hvis man bliver forsinket, ringer man og giver besked.

forsinke -r, -de, -t 延迟

besked -en, -er, -erne 消息

afbud -det -dene 取消

aftale -n, -r, -rne 约定

forhold -et, -, -ene 关系

nødvendig -t, -e | -ere, -st adj 必要的，必须的，反义词：unødvendig

spontan -t, -e adj 自发的，想当然的

være i nu’et 活在当下

anmelde -r, anmeldte, anmeldt 注册的，提前告知的，提前打好招呼的

  • uanmeldte gæster 不速之客

planlægge -r, …lagde, …lagt 制定计划

Synspunkt + argument med: for så / for ellers

  • for så 因为那样的话，……（怎么怎么样）

    Det er godt/vigtigt at + inf, for så + inversion

  • for ellers 否则的话，……（会怎么样）

    Det er godt/vigtigt at + inf, for ellers + inversion

    for ellers = for hvis ikke …, så …

后面都要倒装（动词第二位原则）

Hvordan er forholdet til tid i Kina?

Jeg synes, at det kommer en på hvilken situation. Hvis man flyver eller tager toget med, skal man altid ankomme til lufthavnen eller banegården i forvejen og vent, for ellers vil man gå glip af det. Hvis du skal besøge en ven, er det okay at komme 5-10 minutter for sent.

Hvad er mit eget forhold til tid?

Jeg tror, at det er godt at være punktlig. Jeg prøver altid at komme til tiden.

entry.title: 丹麦语 DU 3.3 1 Ligheder og forskelle
entry.content:
lighed -en -er -erne 相同点

forskel -len -le -lene 不同点

tillid -en 信任

at lægge mærke til 注意到

  • Har du lagt mærke til, at det er begyndt at regne?
  • Jeg har lagt mærke til, at du har fået en ny frisure.

at undre sig over 想知道某事，惊讶于某事

  • Jeg undrer mig over, hvorfor toget er forsinket.
  • Hun undrede sig over, hvordan det kunne ske.

at vænne sig til 习惯于

  • Det tager tid at vænne sig til et nyt job.
  • Jeg har vænnet mig til at stå tidligt op. 我习惯于早起。

Kulturmødet - ligheder og forskelle

anderledes - - 不同的 adj

rig -t -e | -ere -est 有钱的，富有的

fattig -t -e | -ere -st 贫穷的，可怜的

ladcykel 载货自行车

mærkelig -t -e 惊奇的，奇怪的

sej -t -e 强壮的，酷的

barselsorlov -en -er -erne 产假

ligeværdig -t -e 平等

at lægge vægt på 认为……很重要

frisind -et 开放包容

genere -r -de -t 造成麻烦，打扰

høflighedsfraser 礼貌用语

复习主从复合句

记得从句中加中心副词时，中心副词放在动词之前。

从句如果放在句首，占第一位，动词第二位（所谓的倒装 inversion）

复习 hovedsætningskonjunktioner （主句连词）

og 表连接，然后，和

men 表转折，但是

eller 表选择，或者

for 表原因，因为

så 表结果，所以

Ordstilling i hovedsætninger

陈述句的语序：

一般是 主语 + 动词 1 + 中心副词 + 动词 2 + 间接宾语 + 直接宾语 + 地点副词 + 时间副词

f.eks. Han vil vist vise dem huset i Virum på søndag.

hv-疑问句语序：

疑问词 + 动词 1 + 主语 + 中心副词 + 动词 2 + 间接宾语 + 直接宾语 + 地点副词 + 时间副词

f.eks. Hvorfor vil hun ikke vise dem huset i Virum i dag?

当然，陈述句为了强调某些成分，可以将该成分提前到第一个位置，然后动词 1 总是遵循第二位原则。

强调中心副词: Formodentlig vil de give ham kontrakten i dag.

强调间接宾语: Ham vil de formodentlig give kontrakten i dag.

强调直接宾语: Kontrakten vil de formodentlig give ham i dag.

强调时间副词: I dag vil de formodentlig give ham kontrakten.

Formodentlig adv 想必，显然，十有八九（表推测）

Folk/Mennesker/Personer 辨析

  • Folk

    • 非个人，一个群体（数量不重要）

      Eks. Folk var flinke og imødekommende.

      Eks. Folk glemmer tit at rydde op efter sig i kantinen.

  • Mennesker

    • 通常指一群特定的人，通常在代词或形容词之后（mange, en del, de fleste, ingen, nogle …）

      Eks. De fleste mennesker er nervøse til en jobsamtale.

      Eks. De er helt almindelige mennesker.

      Eks. De var mange kendte mennesker til festen.

    • 关于若干个人（指定数量）

      Eks. Der er omkring 150 mennesker.

    • 表示“人类”这个物种

      Eks. Vi kan ikke arbejde uden pauser, for vi er mennesker, ikke robotter.

  • Personer

    • 关于若干个人（指定数量）

      Eks. Der er omkring 150 personer.

    • 非个人化——一般在官方文档、技术文档中出现

      Eks. Der er plads til 15 personer i mødelokalet.

      Eks. Ingen slag af spiritus for personer under 18 år.

entry.title: 德语 阴阳中性词汇的辨别方法
entry.content:
通用方法

前缀 Ge-

凡是以 Ge- 开头的，并且表示“一类事物总称”的名词，100% 是中性的。

das Gebäude 建筑物

das Gericht 菜肴、法院

das Getränk 饮料

das Gemüse 蔬菜

das Gebäck 烘烤饼干

das Gepäck 行李

das Gespräch 谈话、对话

后缀 -um

凡是以 -um 结尾的名词，100% 都是中性的

das Studium 大学课程

das Stipendium 奖学金

das Museum 博物馆

das Kriterium 标准

das Zentrum 中心

das Datum 日期、数据

das Wachstum 增长

das Visum 签证

后缀 -schaft

凡是以 -schaft 结尾的名词，100% 阴性，毫无悬念，类似于英语中的后缀 -ship，表示“一种抽象的关系”。

die Wissenschaft 科学

die Wirtschaft 经济

die Nachbarschaft 邻里关系

die Freundschaft 友谊

die Bereitschaft 意愿

die Gewerkschaft 工会

后缀 -keit / -heit

凡是后缀是 -keit 或者 -heit 的名词，100%是阴性的

die Gesundheit 健康

die Freiheit 自由

die Möglichkeit 可能性

die Flüssigkeit 液体

die Besonderheit 特别

die Einheit 统一

die Ähnlichkeit 相似性

die Unterschiedlichkeit 不同，区别

以 e 结尾

  1. 98% 以字母 -e 结尾的名词是阴性的

die Schule学校

die Tasche包、口袋

die Marmelade 果酱

die Erdbeere 草莓

die Tasse 咖啡杯

die Folge 顺序、后果

die Frage 问题

die Reise 旅游

die Panne 故障

die Lunge 肺

  1. 另外有一小部分以 -e 结尾的名词是阳性的，并且都是弱变化

der Kunde 顾客

der Affe 猴子

der Löwe 狮子

der Kollege 男同事

但是 der Käse 不是弱变化

  1. 还有少数是中性的，比如

das Ende结束

das Wochenende周末

典型的阳性名词

  1. 带如拉丁或希腊语系的词尾/后缀的名词为阳性弱变化名词，其重音在后缀上

-tant

der Adjuntant (en en) 副官

der Protestant (en en) 新教徒

-krat

der Aristokrat (en en) 贵族

der Autokrat (en en) 独裁者

-osoph

der Philosoph (en en) 哲学家

der Theosoph (en en) 通神学

-olog

der Philolog(e) (en en) 语言学家

der Theolog(e) (en en) 神学家

-et

der Poet (en en) 诗人

der Komet (en en) 彗星

-ist

der Pianist (en en) 钢琴家

der Prokurist (en en) 代理人

-it

der Bandit (en en) 土匪

der Jesuit (en en) 耶酥会会士

-graph

der Geograph (en en) 地理学家

der Telegraph (en en) 电报

-ast

der Enthusiast (en en) 热心人

der Phantast (en en) 空想家

-rad

der Kamerad (en en) 同志

-kat

der Advokat (en en) 律师

-dat

der Kandidat (en en) 候选人

-rat

der Magistrat (en en) 高级官员

还有带外来语后缀 -al, -ar, -ent, -eur, -ier, -or, -us 的词，也为阳性

der General (s e) 将军

der Ingenieur (s e) 工程师

der Student (en en) 学生

der Kasus (- -) 语法格

  1. 动词去掉词尾 -en，加 -er，形成阳性名词，指做动作的人，复数不再改变词尾

besuchen - der Besucher

lehren - der Lehrer

  1. 阳性名词前加 erz-，表示大，为主或首要的意思，复数和原词相同

der Bischof 主教

der Erzbischof - die Erzbischöfe 大主教

  1. 大多数表示阳性生物的名词，都为阳性

der Arbeiter 工人

der Loewe 雄师

der Vater 父亲

der Hahn 公鸡

  1. 四季，月份，星期几，都为阳性

der Frühling 春天

der Mai 五月

der Montag 周一

der Sonntag 周日

  1. 表示方向的词，都为阳性

der Osten 东方

der Westen 西方

  1. 表示风霜雨雪的词，都为阳性

der Regen 雨

der Wind 风

der Schnee 雪

der Reif 霜

  1. 大多数以 -en 结尾(但不包括动名词或以 -chen 结尾的词)，为阳性

der Hafen 港口

der Laden 商店

  1. 各种汽车名词，都为阳性

der VW (Volkswagen) 大众汽车

der LKW (Lastkraftwagen) 载重汽车

典型的中性名词

  1. 在形容词或名词后加 -tum 变成中性名词，复数形式为 -tümer

heilig - das Heiligtum - die Heiligtümer 圣地，圣物

der König - das Königtum - die Königtümer 王位，王权

alt - das Altertum - die Altertümer 古代，古器

  1. 词尾为 -ium 或 -um 的词是中性，复数形式一般为 -ien 或 -en，但有例外

das Studium die Studien

das Museum die Museen

例外：das Praktikum die Praktika

还有带后缀 -chen, -lein, -sal, -tel, -icht, -ett, -in 的名词都为中性

das Häuschen 小屋

das Büchlein 小册子

das Dickicht 灌木丛

das Schicksal 命运

das Drittel 三分之一，第三

Das Ballett 芭蕾

das Benzin 汽油

  1. 表示幼小生物的名词，多为中性

das Kind

das Lamm 羊羔

  1. 几乎所有金属及化学名词，都为中性

das Benzol 苯

das Ethylacetat 乙酸乙酯

das Gold 黄金

das Jod 碘

das Uran 铀

例外：der Stahl 钢 die Bronze 铜

  1. 名词化的动词，形容词或分词等，都为中性

das Leben 生活，生命

das Grün 绿色

典型的阴性名词

  1. 表示人的名词后加 -in 则成为阴性名词，其复数形式是：innen

der Protestant die Protestantin die Protestantinnen 女新教徒

  1. 动词后加 -rei 变来的名词为阴性，复数为：reien

backen die Bäckerei die Bäckereien 面包店

  1. 形容词或名词后加 -heit 形成的词为阴性，复数形式为：heiten

frei die Freiheit die Freiheiten 自由

schön die Schönheit die Schönheiten 美丽

  1. 动词去掉词尾 -en 后加 -ung 形成的词为阴性，复数形式为：ungen

warnen die Warnung die Warnungen 警告

meinen die Meinung die Meinungen 想法，看法

verbinden die Verbindung die Verbindungen 连接，联系

  1. 名词后后加 -schaft 形成的词为阴性，复数形式为：schaften
  2. 从外来语转化而来词尾为 -e 的词是阴性，复数形式为：en

die Adresse die Adressen

die Methode die Methoden

  1. 词尾为 -sion 或 -tion 的词是阴性，复数形式为：sionen 或 tionen

die Division die Divisionen 除法

die Portion die Portionen 份

  1. 词尾为 -tät 的词是阴性，复数形式为：täten

die Qualität die Qualitäten

die Universität die Universitäten

  1. 词尾为 -ur 的词是阴性，复数形式为：uren

die Natur die Naturen

  1. 词尾为 -enz 或 -anz 的词是阴性，复数形式为：enzen 或 anzen

die Residenz die Residenzen 王府，官邸

  1. 词尾为 -ie 的词是阴性，复数形式为：ien

die Industrie die Industrien

还有带外来语后缀 -a, -age, -ik, -ive 的名词为阴性

die Ära 纪元

die Garage 车库

die Fabrik 工厂

die Defensiv 防御

  1. 多数表示阴性生物的名词为阴性

die Frau

die Kuh 母牛

die Stute 牝马，牝骆驼，牝驴

  1. 大多数表示花草，树木，水果等名词为阴性（苹果是阳性）

die Rose

die Lilie 百合

die Birne 梨

  1. 名词化的数词都为阴性

die Fünf

die Zehn

die Tausend

  1. 以国家或城市命名的船只都为阴性

die Bremen 不来梅号

die Hessen 黑森号

  1. 后缀为t的名词都为阴性

die Fahrt 行驶

形成不同词性的前缀和后缀

后缀 -nis

形容词或动词后加 -nis 形成的词为阴性或中性，复数形式为：nisse

wild die Wildnis die Wildnisse 荒地

kennen die Kenntnis die Kenntnisse 了解程度，知识

bilden das Bildnis die Bildnisse 肖像

erlauben die Erlaubnis die Erlaubnisse 许可

前缀 ge-

名词前加 ge- 形成集体性或联合性名词，复数形式按其不同词尾来定

das Wasser das Gewässer die Gewässer 积水，水域

das Spiel der Gespiele die Gespielen 玩伴

动词前加 ge- 形成表示动作的名词，复数形式按其不同词尾来定

reden das Gerede die Gerede 废话，闲话

bauen das Gebäude die Gebäude 建筑物

beten das Gebet die Gebete 祈祷

前缀 un-

名词前加 un- 形成相反意思的名词，复数形式与原来的词相同

der Dank der Undank die Undank 忘恩负义

前缀 ur-

名词前加 ur- 形成的名词，表示原始，本源或古老的意思，复数形式与原来的词相同

das Volk das Urvolk die Urvölker 原始人

后缀 -ett, -ier, -il, -ment

带后缀 -ett, -ier, -il 及 -ment 的名词多为中性，少数为阳性，复数在后缀上加 -e

das Skelett die Skelette 骨架，骷髅

das Papier die Papiere 纸

das Experiment die Experimente 实验

das Reptil die Reptile 爬行动物

entry.title: 算法和计算复杂度 7 Bounded Depth Boolean Circuits
entry.content:
What if Boolean circuits has bounded depth?

Depth of Boolean circuit: the length of a longest path from an input gate to an output gate.

It’s a model of parallel computation where depth corresponds to parallel time.

Parallel model of random access machine PRAM 痛苦的计算几何课的回忆

📖Definition of SIZE−DEPTHSIZE-DEPTHSIZE−DEPTH. Let S:N→NS:\mathbb N\to\mathbb NS:N→N and d:N→Nd:\mathbb N\to\mathbb Nd:N→N. SIZE−DEPTH(S(n),d(n))SIZE-DEPTH(S(n),d(n))SIZE−DEPTH(S(n),d(n)) is the class of languages computed by families of Boolean circuits of size O(S(n))O(S(n))O(S(n)) and depth O(d(n))O(d(n))O(d(n)).

📖Definition of NCiNC^iNCi. For i≥0i\ge0i≥0, define NCi=SIZE−DEPTH(nO(1),log⁡i(n))NC^i=SIZE-DEPTH(n^{O(1)},\log^i(n))NCi=SIZE−DEPTH(nO(1),logi(n)), and further define NC=∪i≥1NCiNC=\cup_{i\ge1}NC^iNC=∪i≥1​NCi.

These circuit classes is restrict to polynomial size and poly-logarithmic depth.

By definition, NC⊆P/polyNC\subseteq P/polyNC⊆P/poly, hence UL−NC⊆PU_L-NC\subseteq PUL​−NC⊆P.

为什么呢？回顾定义 P/poly=⋃k>0SIZE(nk)P/poly=\bigcup_{k\gt0}SIZE(n^k)P/poly=⋃k>0​SIZE(nk)，发现它的多了一个深度的限制。

In fact P⊈NCP\not\subseteq NCP⊆NC is expected to hold. This means not all languages in PPP can benefit greatly from parallelism.

General Boolean Circuits

Consider Boolean circuits that allows arbitrary fanin gate and more general functions than AND,OR,NOTAND, OR, NOTAND,OR,NOT.

General definition of Boolean circuit. A Boolean circuit CCC with nnn inputs and mmm outputs consists of the following:

  • An underlying directed acyclic graph D=(V,A)D=(V,A)D=(V,A) (multiple arcs is allowed)
  • A labeling ℓ\ellℓ of the nodes of VVV.
  • A linear ordering on the arcs AAA of VVV.
  • A choice of mmm output gates o1,⋯ ,om∈Vo_1,\cdots,o_m\in Vo1​,⋯,om​∈V

The size of CCC is the number of wires. The labelling function ℓ\ellℓ should satisfy the following for all gates ggg:

  • If the fanin of ggg is 000, then ℓ(g)∈{0,1,x1,⋯ ,xn,x1‾,⋯ ,xn‾}\ell(g)\in\{0,1,x_1,\cdots,x_n,\overline{x_1},\cdots,\overline{x_n}\}ℓ(g)∈{0,1,x1​,⋯,xn​,x1​​,⋯,xn​​}.
  • If the fanin of ggg is k≥1k\ge1k≥1, then ℓ(g)=fg\ell(g)=f_gℓ(g)=fg​ where fg:{0,1}k→{0,1}f_g:\{0,1\}^k\to\{0,1\}fg​:{0,1}k→{0,1} is an kkk-ary Boolean function.

CCC compute a Boolean function f:{0,1}n→{0,1}mf:\{0,1\}^n\to\{0,1\}^mf:{0,1}n→{0,1}m in a natural way.

Boolean functions with k-ary

AND(z_1,\cdots,z_k)=z_1\and\cdots\and z_k\\OR(z_1,\cdots,z_k)=z_1\or\cdots\or z_k\\MOD_m(z_1,\cdots,z_k)=\begin{cases}1\ if\ \sum_{i=1}^kz_i\not\equiv0\mod m\\0\ if\ \sum_{i=1}^kz_i\equiv0\mod m\end{cases}

MOD2MOD_2MOD2​ is the same as the xor-sum.

The major voting function MAJMAJMAJ:

MAJ(z1,⋯ ,zk)={1 if ∑i=1kzi≥k20 if ∑i=1kzi<k2MAJ(z_1,\cdots,z_k)=\begin{cases}1\ if\ \sum_{i=1}^kz_i\ge\frac{k}{2}\\0\ if\ \sum_{i=1}^kz_i\lt\frac{k}{2}\end{cases}MAJ(z1​,⋯,zk​)={1 if ∑i=1k​zi​≥2k​0 if ∑i=1k​zi​<2k​​

Let w=(w1,⋯ ,wk)∈Rkw=(w_1,\cdots,w_k)\in\mathbb R^kw=(w1​,⋯,wk​)∈Rk be weights and t∈Rt\in\mathbb Rt∈R be a threshold. Then THRw,tTHR_{w,t}THRw,t​ is defined:

THRw,t(z1,⋯ ,zk)={1 if ∑i=1kwizi≥t0 if ∑i=1kwizi<tTHR_{w,t}(z_1,\cdots,z_k)=\begin{cases}1\ if\ \sum_{i=1}^kw_iz_i\ge t\\0\ if\ \sum_{i=1}^kw_iz_i\lt t\end{cases}THRw,t​(z1​,⋯,zk​)={1 if ∑i=1k​wi​zi​≥t0 if ∑i=1k​wi​zi​<t​

When all weights is 111,

Tt(z1,⋯ ,zk)={1 if ∑i=1kzi≥t0 if ∑i=1kzi<tT_t(z_1,\cdots,z_k)=\begin{cases}1\ if\ \sum_{i=1}^kz_i\ge t\\0\ if\ \sum_{i=1}^kz_i\lt t\end{cases}Tt​(z1​,⋯,zk​)={1 if ∑i=1k​zi​≥t0 if ∑i=1k​zi​<t​

Several Circuit Classes

📖Definition of ACiAC^iACi. For i≥0i\ge0i≥0, ACiAC^iACi is the class of languages computed by families of Boolean circuits of polynomial size and depth O(log⁡in)O(\log^in)O(login) using unbounded fanin ANDANDAND and OROROR gates.

ACiAC^iACi is similar to NCiNC^iNCi.

🤔Proposition 5. Hierarchy relation between NCNCNC and ACACAC. NCi⊆ACi⊆NCi+1NC^i\subseteq AC^i\subseteq NC^{i+1}NCi⊆ACi⊆NCi+1 for all i≥0i\ge0i≥0.

NCi⊆ACiNC^i\subseteq AC^iNCi⊆ACi is obtained by definition.

For ACi⊆NCi+1AC^i\subseteq NC^{i+1}ACi⊆NCi+1: ANDANDAND and OROROR gates of fanin kkk can be replaced by a binary tree of depth ⌈log⁡2k⌉\lceil\log_2k\rceil⌈log2​k⌉ of corresponding fanin 222 gates. Thus the depth increases by a factor O(log⁡n)O(\log n)O(logn).

📖Definition of AC0,ACC0AC^0,ACC^0AC0,ACC0. Let m>1m\gt1m>1. AC0[m]AC^0[m]AC0[m] is the class of languages computed by families of Boolean circuits of polynomial size and depth O(1)O(1)O(1) using unbounded fanin AND,OR,MODmAND,OR,MOD_mAND,OR,MODm​ gates. Define ACC0=⋃m>1AC0[m]ACC^0=\bigcup_{m\gt1}AC^0[m]ACC0=⋃m>1​AC0[m].

📖Definition of TC0TC^0TC0. TC0TC^0TC0 is the class of languages computed by families of Boolean circuits of polynomial size and depth O(1)O(1)O(1) using unbounded fanin MAJMAJMAJ gates only.

语言类 TC0TC^0TC0 可以被看做神经网络。

Logarithmic Space and Logarithmic Depth Circuits

log-space can be roughly the same as log-depth circuits.

🎯Theorem 38. UL−NC1⊆LU_L-NC^1\subseteq LUL​−NC1⊆L.

Circuit CCC with depth (log⁡n)(\log n)(logn) is computable by a O(log⁡n)O(\log n)O(logn) space Turing Machine.

📖Definition of Boolean product of matrices. A=(aij)∈{0,1}m×r,B=(bij)∈{0,1}r×nA=(a_{ij})\in\{0,1\}^{m\times r},B=(b_{ij})\in\{0,1\}^{r\times n}A=(aij​)∈{0,1}m×r,B=(bij​)∈{0,1}r×n. The Boolean product ABABAB is the m×nm\times nm×n Boolean matrix C=(cij)C=(c_{ij})C=(cij​) s.t.

c_{ij}=\bigvee_{k=1}^ra_{ik}\and a_{kj}.

A n×nn\times nn×n Boolean matrix corresponds to a directed graph. The transitive closure of the graph gives rise to the transitive closure of the matrix.

回想起大二学的离散数学了吗？邻接矩阵的闭包与可达性。

📖Definition of transitive closure. Transitive closure A∗A^*A∗ of AAA is the n×nn\times nn×n Boolean matrix given by A∗=⋁i≥0AiA^*=\bigvee_{i\ge0}A^iA∗=⋁i≥0​Ai, where A0A^0A0 is the identity matrix III.

🎯Theorem 39. NL⊆UL−AC1NL\subseteq U_L-AC^1NL⊆UL​−AC1

懒得看证明了，到学的时候再来

🤔Corollary 6. UL−NC1⊆L⊆NL⊆UL−AC1U_L-NC^1\subseteq L\subseteq NL\subseteq U_L-AC^1UL​−NC1⊆L⊆NL⊆UL​−AC1.

其实这里也存在层次结构：NL⊆UL−AC1⊆UL−NC2⊆L2(=DSPACE(log⁡2n))NL\subseteq U_L-AC^1\subseteq U_L-NC^2\subseteq L^2(=DSPACE(\log^2n))NL⊆UL​−AC1⊆UL​−NC2⊆L2(=DSPACE(log2n)).

Functions and Reductions

Boolean circuit is fixed number of inputs, we consider output is also a bounded function of the length of input.

📖Definition of length-respecting. A function f:{0,1}∗→{0,1}∗f:\{0,1\}^*\to\{0,1\}^*f:{0,1}∗→{0,1}∗ is length-respecting if for all x,y∈{0,1}∗x,y\in\{0,1\}^*x,y∈{0,1}∗, we have ∣x∣=∣y∣⇒∣f(x)∣=∣f(y)∣|x|=|y|\Rarr|f(x)|=|f(y)|∣x∣=∣y∣⇒∣f(x)∣=∣f(y)∣.

📖Definition of AC0AC^0AC0 Turing reduction. Let fff and ggg be length-respecting Boolean functions. We say fff reduces to ggg by an AC0AC^0AC0 Turing reduction if fff is computed by a family of Boolean functions of polynomial size and depth O(1)O(1)O(1) using unbounded fanin ANDANDAND and OROROR gates as well as gates computing any coordinate function of ggg.

什么玩意啊，绕来绕去的

If fff reduces to ggg by an AC0AC^0AC0 Turing reduction, it is denoted by f≤TAC0gf\le_T^{AC^0}gf≤TAC0​g.

Easy to see that AC0AC^0AC0 Turing reductions satisfy transitivity.

🤔Lemma 8. If f≤TAC0gf\le_T^{AC^0}gf≤TAC0​g and g≤TAC0hg\le_T^{AC^0}hg≤TAC0​h, then f≤TAC0hf\le_T^{AC^0}hf≤TAC0​h.

Addition and Multiplication

ADDADDADD: given nnn-bit numbers xxx and yyy, output n+1n+1n+1-bit number zzz s.t. z=x+yz=x+yz=x+y.

MULTMULTMULT: given nnn-bit numbers xxx and yyy, output 2n2n2n-bit number zzz s.t. z=xyz=xyz=xy.

🎯Theorem 40. ADD∈AC0ADD\in AC^0ADD∈AC0.

!!!

A generalization of ADDADDADD: iterated addition of nnn numbers each of nnn bits.

ITADDITADDITADD: given nnn numbers x1,⋯ ,xnx^1,\cdots,x^nx1,⋯,xn of nnn bits each, output n+⌈log⁡2n⌉n+\lceil\log_2n\rceiln+⌈log2​n⌉-bit number zzz s.t. z=x1+⋯+xnz=x^1+\cdots+x^nz=x1+⋯+xn.

🎯Theorem 41. ITADD∈NC1ITADD\in NC^1ITADD∈NC1.

We can to reduce the task to the task of add 222 numbers each of n+O(log⁡n)n+O(\log n)n+O(logn) bits. These may be added in depth O(log⁡n)O(\log n)O(logn) by converting AC0AC^0AC0 for ADDADDADD to a NC1NC^1NC1 circuit.

🤔Corollary 7. TC0⊆NC1TC^0\subseteq NC^1TC0⊆NC1.

Note that MAJ≤TAC0ITADDMAJ\le_T^{AC^0}ITADDMAJ≤TAC0​ITADD by computing the sum of the input bits and comparing to the threshold value.

🤔Proposition 6. MULT≤TAC0ITADDMULT\le_T^{AC^0}ITADDMULT≤TAC0​ITADD.

Given nnn-bit numbers xxx and yyy, we form the nnn numbers ziz^izi, each of 2n−12n-12n−1 bits by letting zi=xi2iyz^i=x_i2^iyzi=xi​2iy for 0≤i<n0\le i\lt n0≤i<n. Then the product is simply the sum of the numbers z0,⋯ ,zn−1z^0,\cdots,z^{n-1}z0,⋯,zn−1.

BCOUNTBCOUNTBCOUNT: given nnn-bit number xxx, output ⌈log⁡2n+1⌉\lceil\log_2^n+1\rceil⌈log2n​+1⌉-bit number zzz, the sum of each bit.

Clearly BCOUNT≤TAC0ITADDBCOUNT\le_T^{AC^0}ITADDBCOUNT≤TAC0​ITADD.

🤔Proposition 7. ITADD≤TAC0BCOUNTITADD\le_T^{AC^0}BCOUNTITADD≤TAC0​BCOUNT

看不懂这个特例，但是图灵归约一般不是对称的

🤔Proposition 8. Let fff be a symmetric Boolean function. Then f∈TC0f\in TC^0f∈TC0.

🤔Corollary 8. ACC0⊆TC0ACC^0\subseteq TC^0ACC0⊆TC0.

🤔Proposition 9. MAJ≤TAC0MULTMAJ\le_T^{AC^0}MULTMAJ≤TAC0​MULT.

😭这些证明都不想看

🎯Theorem 42. MULTMULTMULT is complete for TC0TC^0TC0 under ≤TAC0\le_T^{AC^0}≤TAC0​ reductions.

Linear Threshold Functions

Using integers of bit-size O(nlog⁡n)O(n\log n)O(nlogn) as weights is sufficient to realize any linear threshold function.

🤔Lemma 9. Let fff be a linear threshold function on nnn bits. Then there exists integers w1,⋯ ,wnw_1,\cdots,w_nw1​,⋯,wn​ and ttt of magnitude at most (n+1)n+12(n+1)^{\frac{n+1}{2}}(n+1)2n+1​ s.t. f=THRw,tf=THR_{w,t}f=THRw,t​.

证明跳过。

It’s possible to improve the upper bound to (n+1)n+12/2n(n+1)^{\frac{n+1}{2}}/2^n(n+1)2n+1​/2n.

🤔Corollary 9. Let fff be a linear threshold function. Then f∈TC0f\in TC^0f∈TC0.

读下来感觉好崩溃💀

很难想象考试的时候是有多么悲惨。这么多定义都记不住，更何况这么多定理😭

entry.title: Codeforces Round 963 (Div. 2) 部分题目总结
entry.content:
本次比赛 链接。说实话出的比较糟糕，题目难度的梯度非常不均匀。

A, B, C 题没什么好说的，跳过。

D. Med-imize

题目大意

给定一个包含 n 个 int 的数组 a，给定 k。在 a 中，每次选择长度刚好为 k 的任意的连续子数组进行删除，删除至 a 长度小于等于 k 为止。求删除操作结束后数组 a 最大可能的中位数值。

解题思路

二分搜索答案 + 动态规划。

当输入数组长度小于等于 k 时，答案就是当前数组的中位数。

❓如何在不排序的情况下求出一个数组的中位数呢？二分查找。

  • 对每一个给定的值 x，建立另一个和 a 一样大的标签数组 b。
    • 当 x<=a[i] 时，标记 b[i]=1；反之 b[i]=-1。
    • 这样通过判断 b 数组和的正负性，我们就能判断 x 是否比中位数小了。

当 n>k 时，同理进行二分搜索答案。为了检查当前值是否小于最优可能解，我们只需使用动态规划求出 b 数组最大的和，检查其正负性。

❓如何用动归求 b 数组最大的和呢？

注意到每次删除完成后数组的长度为 m=((n-1)%k)+1。

注意到删除完成后的数组 a' 中的每一位一定来自于原数组：

a′[0],⋯ ,a′[m−1]⇐a[i0],⋯ ,a[im−1]a'[0],\cdots,a'[m-1]\Larr a[i_0],\cdots,a[i_{m-1}]a′[0],⋯,a′[m−1]⇐a[i0​],⋯,a[im−1​]

其中对应的原数组下标必须满足

i0≡0mod  ki1≡1mod  k⋮im−1≡m−1mod  ki_0\equiv0\mod k\\i_1\equiv1\mod k\\\vdots\\i_{m-1}\equiv m-1\mod ki0​≡0modki1​≡1modk⋮im−1​≡m−1modk

为何？因为每次刚好删除的是 a 中连续的 k 个，删除之后并不影响每个下标模 k 的结果。

令 dp[i] 表示数组 a 中前 i 个数字中选择满足下标要求的 k 个数对应 b 数组之和的最大值，综上可得动态规划递推关系：

  • dp[0]=b[0]
  • 如果 i%k==0&&i>0，dp[i]=max(dp[i-k],b[i])（有可能把 i 之前的所有全删除了，从 i 开始）
  • 否则
    • 如果 i<=k，dp[i]=dp[i-1]+b[i]。（只有选上当前数字）
    • 如果 i>k，dp[i]=max(dp[i-1]+b[i],dp[i-k])。（要么选当前数字，要么把包括这个数字之前总共 k 个数字都删了，选第 i-k 个数字）

最后只需检查 dp[n-1] 是否大于零即可。

参考代码

E. Xor-Grid Problem

题目大意

给一个 n×mn\times mn×m 的矩阵，两种操作：

  1. 选定第 iii 行，将该行的每一个数都替换成该数对应列的所有数的异或值；
  2. 选定第 jjj 列，将该列的每一个数都替换成该数对应行的所有数的异或值。

可以执行操作任意次。最后计算矩阵的“美丽值”：

beauty(a)=∑∣ax,y−ar,c∣beauty(a)=\sum|a_{x,y}-a_{r,c}|beauty(a)=∑∣ax,y​−ar,c​∣

对矩阵中任意两个共享一条边的格子。

求最小的“美丽值”。

解题思路

观察到：

  • 尝试连续对某一行进行两次相同的操作，发现结果不变
  • 尝试对第 iii 行进行操作，再尝试对第 i′i'i′ 行进行操作，发现 i′i'i′ 行上的数字刚好就是原始第 iii 行上的数字。

本质上相当于：

将原始的矩阵拓展一行一列变成 (n+1)×(m+1)(n+1)\times(m+1)(n+1)×(m+1)。a[i][m+1]a[i][m+1]a[i][m+1] 就是第 iii 行所有数的异或值，同理 a[n+1][j]a[n+1][j]a[n+1][j] 就是第 jjj 列所有数的异或值。

每一次操作就是将第 iii 行（或第 jjj 列）与第 n+1n+1n+1 行（或第 m+1m+1m+1 列）进行交换。妙蛙

现在问题就转化为行和列的排列问题。

接下来拆解美丽值，美丽值可以分为两部分，横向的相邻格和纵向的相邻格。（⚠️在操作结束之后，扩展的那一行/列就不要参与到美丽值的计算中了！）

计算 dr[u][v]dr[u][v]dr[u][v] 表示第 uuu 行和第 vvv 行的差值；dc[u][v]dc[u][v]dc[u][v] 表示对应列的差值。

因此美丽值可以转化为

∑i=2ndr[ri−1][ri]+∑i=2mdc[ci−1][ci]\sum_{i=2}^ndr[r_{i-1}][r_i]+\sum_{i=2}^mdc[c_{i-1}][c_i]i=2∑n​dr[ri−1​][ri​]+i=2∑m​dc[ci−1​][ci​]

dr,dcdr,dcdr,dc 可以看成两个邻接矩阵分别对应两张图。此问题等价于 TSP。

F. Dyn-scripted Robot

题目大意

有一个机器人初始位于平面坐标 (0,0)(0,0)(0,0) 上。给定一个长度为 nnn 的指令序列，让机器人上下左右移动。这个指令序列将执行 kkk 次。机器人被限制在高度为 hhh，宽度为 www 的一个矩形区域中。当机器人在边界上如果指令会导致出界，则立即将该方向上所有指令取反。比如当机器人位于右边界时，此时指令向右，则机器人自动将指令序列中所有的左指令变成右指令，右指令变成左指令。

求在整个过程中机器人回到原点的次数。

解题思路

Easy Version

n,w,h≤106,k≤nn,w,h\le10^6,k\le nn,w,h≤106,k≤n.

仔细思考，其实不用考虑反弹的情况，让机器人自由移动，出界的时候其实就相当于进入了一个镜像对称的空间。

其实就相当于有四面镜子分别摆放在矩形区域的四个边上，那么实际上 (2wc1,2hc2),c1,c2∈Z(2wc_1,2hc_2),c_1,c_2\in\mathbb Z(2wc1​,2hc2​),c1​,c2​∈Z 都可以视作原点。所以分别经过取模 2w,2h2w,2h2w,2h，机器人就限制在了长宽为 2w,2h2w,2h2w,2h 的矩形中。

记 (xi,yi)(x_i,y_i)(xi​,yi​) 为机器人执行第一遍指令序列时每一步所在的位置。则指令完成后机器人位于 (xn,yn)(x_n,y_n)(xn​,yn​)。

此后机器人在执行第 jjj 遍指令序列时的第 iii 个指令，所在的位置为 (jxn+xi,jyn+yi)(jx_n+x_i,jy_n+y_i)(jxn​+xi​,jyn​+yi​)。同时，需要满足

x≡0mod  2w⇒xi≡−jxnmod  2wy≡0mod  2h⇒yi≡−jynmod  2hx\equiv0\mod 2w\Rarr x_i\equiv-jx_n\mod 2w\\y\equiv0\mod 2h\Rarr y_i\equiv-jy_n\mod 2hx≡0mod2w⇒xi​≡−jxn​mod2wy≡0mod2h⇒yi​≡−jyn​mod2h

直接遍历 000 到 k−1k-1k−1，对每一遍指令序列满足同余关系数量求和。最终得到答案。

可以用 map 存储执行第一遍指令序列机器人位于长宽为 2w,2h2w,2h2w,2h 的矩形内每一个点的经过次数。

Hard Version

k≤1012k\le10^{12}k≤1012

kkk 的范围导致了不能遍历 kkk，猜想是在同余方程上做文章。

不会😭

entry.title: 算法和计算复杂度 6 Randomized Computation
entry.content:
What if Turing machine models have access to a source of randomness?

This would allow to compute more in same time/space, at the price of possibly not giving correct answer with small probability.

Current consensus: Randomization only gives

  • Polynomial saving in time
  • Constant factor saving in space

Because of hardness-based pseudo-random generator.

Exponential time: E=DTIME(2O(n))=UL−SIZE(2O(n))E=DTIME(2^{O(n)})=U_L-SIZE(2^{O(n)})E=DTIME(2O(n))=UL​−SIZE(2O(n)). (By corollary 2)

Recall that SIZE(2n/n)SIZE(2^n/n)SIZE(2n/n) includes every Boolean function on nnn variables, making non-uniform inclusion E⊆SIZE(2O(n))E\subseteq SIZE(2^{O(n)})E⊆SIZE(2O(n)).

Corresponding randomized complexity class BPPBPPBPP.

Theorem 33 (Impagliazzo and Wigderson). If there exists L∈EL\in EL∈E s.t. for every nnn and every Boolean circuit CCC computing LLL on input length nnn, the size of CCC must be 2Ω(n)2^{\Omega(n)}2Ω(n), then P=BPPP=BPPP=BPP.

Probabilistic Turing Machines

Give a probabilistic Turing machine an extra read-only and read-once tape which is pre-initialized with uniform and independent random bits. The tape head is allow to only stop or move forward.

Thus everything related to the Turing machines becomes a random variable.

Different kinds of Errors

Zero-sided error aka Las Vegas computation: Turing machine halt in a state “?” with small probability and require correct answer otherwise.

One-sided error: Turing machine may produce false negatives.

Two-sided error: Turing machine may produce false negatives and false positives.

📖Definition 19. Let MMM be a probabilistic Turing machine and LLL a language.

  • MMM computes LLL with zero-sided error if for all xxx we have Pr⁡[M(x)=?]≤14\Pr[M(x)=?]\le\frac{1}{4}Pr[M(x)=?]≤41​, that M(x)∈{yes,?}M(x)\in\{yes,?\}M(x)∈{yes,?} when x∈Lx\in Lx∈L, and that M(x)∈{no,?}M(x)\in\{no,?\}M(x)∈{no,?} when x∉Lx\not\in Lx∈L.
  • MMM computes LLL with one-sided error if for all x∈Lx\in Lx∈L we have Pr⁡[M(x)=yes]≥34\Pr[M(x)=yes]\ge\frac{3}{4}Pr[M(x)=yes]≥43​ and for all x∉Lx\not\in Lx∈L we have M(x)=noM(x)=noM(x)=no.
  • MMM computes LLL with two-sided error if for all x∈Lx\in Lx∈L we have Pr⁡[M(x)=yes]≥34\Pr[M(x)=yes]\ge\frac{3}{4}Pr[M(x)=yes]≥43​ and for all x∉Lx\not\in Lx∈L we have Pr⁡[M(x)=no]≥34\Pr[M(x)=no]\ge\frac{3}{4}Pr[M(x)=no]≥43​.

📖Definition 20. Let T:N→NT:\mathbb N\rarr\mathbb NT:N→N and S:N→NS:\mathbb N\rarr\mathbb NS:N→N be functions with T(n)≥nT(n)\ge nT(n)≥n.

  • Then ZPTIME(T(n))ZPTIME(T(n))ZPTIME(T(n)), RTIME(T(n))RTIME(T(n))RTIME(T(n)) and BPTIME(T(n))BPTIME(T(n))BPTIME(T(n)) are the classes of languages computed by a O(T(n))O(T(n))O(T(n)) time-bounded probabilistic Turing machine with zero-sided error, one-sided error and two-sided error respectively.
  • ZPSPACE(S(n))ZPSPACE(S(n))ZPSPACE(S(n)), RSPACE(S(n))RSPACE(S(n))RSPACE(S(n)) and BPSPACE(S(n))BPSPACE(S(n))BPSPACE(S(n)) are the classes of languages computed by a O(S(n))O(S(n))O(S(n)) space-bounded probabilistic Turing machine that always halt having zero-sided error, one-sided error and two-sided error respectively.

For space bounded randomized classes, we assume that the Turing machine always halts! Because otherwise these three classes would end up containing NSPACE(S(n))NSPACE(S(n))NSPACE(S(n))!

Define log-space/polynomial time bounded classes:

ZPL=ZPSPACE(log⁡n)RP=RSPACE(log⁡n)BPL=BPSPACE(log⁡n)ZPP=ZPTIME(nO(1))RP=RTIME(nO(1))BPP=BPTIME(nO(1))ZPL=ZPSPACE(\log n)\\RP=RSPACE(\log n)\\BPL=BPSPACE(\log n)\\ZPP=ZPTIME(n^{O(1)})\\RP=RTIME(n^{O(1)})\\BPP=BPTIME(n^{O(1)})ZPL=ZPSPACE(logn)RP=RSPACE(logn)BPL=BPSPACE(logn)ZPP=ZPTIME(nO(1))RP=RTIME(nO(1))BPP=BPTIME(nO(1))

Trivially, L⊆ZPL⊆RL⊆BPLL\subseteq ZPL\subseteq RL\subseteq BPLL⊆ZPL⊆RL⊆BPL; P⊆ZPP⊆RP⊆BPPP\subseteq ZPP\subseteq RP\subseteq BPPP⊆ZPP⊆RP⊆BPP.

It’s also easy to see that RL⊆NLRL\subseteq NLRL⊆NL and RP⊆NPRP\subseteq NPRP⊆NP.

Simple upper bound for BPPBPPBPP (not tight): similar to theorem 10, BPP⊆PSPACEBPP\subseteq PSPACEBPP⊆PSPACE.

For BPLBPLBPL, BPL⊆DSPACE(log⁡3/2n)BPL\subseteq DSPACE(\log^{3/2}n)BPL⊆DSPACE(log3/2n).

Success Amplification

Error probability of 1/41/41/4 is large, but we can reduce it by independently running multiple times.

For zero-sided error, we won’t stop until we get non-unknown answer.

For one-sided error, if some trial accepts, we accept. otherwise we reject.

For two-sided error, we decided the answer by the majority of trials.

🤔Lemma 3. Let X1,⋯ ,XkX_1,\cdots,X_kX1​,⋯,Xk​ be independent Boolean variables s.t. Pr⁡[Xi=1]≥ϵ\Pr[X_i=1]\ge\epsilonPr[Xi​=1]≥ϵ. Then

Pr⁡[∀i:Xi=0]<exp⁡(−kϵ)\Pr[\forall i:X_i=0]\lt\exp(-k\epsilon)Pr[∀i:Xi​=0]<exp(−kϵ)

By independence,

Pr⁡[∀i:Xi=0]=∏iPr⁡[Xi=0]<(1−ϵ)k≤exp⁡(−kϵ).\Pr[\forall i:X_i=0]=\prod_i\Pr[X_i=0]\lt(1-\epsilon)^k\le\exp(-k\epsilon).Pr[∀i:Xi​=0]=i∏​Pr[Xi​=0]<(1−ϵ)k≤exp(−kϵ).

(by 1+x≤exp⁡(x)1+x\le\exp(x)1+x≤exp(x))

Apply this to zero-sided and one-sided errors:

  • Define XiX_iXi​ to indicate whether trial iii gives the correct output.
  • Instead of having error probability 1/41/41/4, we actually assume that error probability for once is less than 1−1p(n)1-\frac{1}{p(n)}1−p(n)1​ and still achieve error probability exp⁡(−q(n))\exp(-q(n))exp(−q(n)) for all by running k=p(n)q(n)k=p(n)q(n)k=p(n)q(n) trials, which is polynomial number.

For two-sided error:

🤔Lemma 4 (Chernoff-Hoeffding Bound). Let XXX be the sum of kkk independent Boolean random variables. Assume μL≤E[X]≤μH\mu_L\le\mathbb E[X]\le\mu_HμL​≤E[X]≤μH​, t>0t>0t>0. Then

Pr⁡[X<μL−t]≤exp⁡(−2t2/k),Pr⁡[X>μH+t]≤exp⁡(−2t2/k).\Pr[X<\mu_L-t]\le\exp(-2t^2/k),\\\Pr[X>\mu_H+t]\le\exp(-2t^2/k).Pr[X<μL​−t]≤exp(−2t2/k),Pr[X>μH​+t]≤exp(−2t2/k).

We define the random indicator XiX_iXi​ to indicate whether trial iii gave correct output. We assume that Pr⁡[Xi=1]≥12+ϵ\Pr[X_i=1]\ge\frac{1}{2}+\epsilonPr[Xi​=1]≥21​+ϵ and kkk is odd. Let X=∑i=1kXiX=\sum_{i=1}^kX_iX=∑i=1k​Xi​, we have E[X]≥k2+kϵ\mathbb E[X]\ge\frac{k}{2}+k\epsilonE[X]≥2k​+kϵ. Applying Chernoff-Hoeffding bound, we have

Pr⁡[X<k2]=Pr⁡[X<μL−kϵ]≤exp⁡(−2(kϵ)2/k)=exp⁡(−2kϵ2)\Pr[X<\frac{k}{2}]=\Pr[X<\mu_L-k\epsilon]\le\exp(-2(k\epsilon)^2/k)\\=\exp(-2k\epsilon^2)Pr[X<2k​]=Pr[X<μL​−kϵ]≤exp(−2(kϵ)2/k)=exp(−2kϵ2)

using μL=k2+kϵ\mu_L=\frac{k}{2}+k\epsilonμL​=2k​+kϵ. Instead of have error probability 1/41/41/4, we assume error probability for once just less than 1/2−1/p(n)1/2-1/p(n)1/2−1/p(n) and achieve error probability exp⁡(−q(n))\exp(-q(n))exp(−q(n)) by running k=p(n)2q(n)2k=\frac{p(n)^2q(n)}{2}k=2p(n)2q(n)​ independent trials.

These analysis applies to both polynomial-time bounded and log-space bounded randomized complexity classes.

Polynomial Identity Testing

Don’t know:

  1. Whether randomized classes have complete problem;
  2. Any hierarchy results for randomized classes.

PIT

Polynomial Identity Testing (PIT): Testing whether a polynomial is identically zero.

PIT problem is efficiently solvable in randomized polynomial time but not known to be solvable deterministically in polynomial time.

📖Definition 21 (Arithmetic circuit). An arithmetic circuit CCC with nnn inputs and mmm outputs consists of the following:

  1. A directed acyclic graph D=(V,A)D=(V,A)D=(V,A) where the in-degree of every node is either 000 or 222.
  2. A labeling ℓ\ellℓ for the nodes VVV.
  3. A choice of mmm outputs gates o1,⋯ ,om∈Vo_1,\cdots,o_m\in Vo1​,⋯,om​∈V.

Nodes VVV corresponds to gates, edges AAA corresponds to wires. Nodes of in-degree 000 are input gates. The labeling function satisfies ∀\forall∀ gates ggg:

  1. If fanin of ggg is 000, ℓ(g)∈{1,x1,⋯ ,xn}\ell(g)\in\{1,x_1,\cdots,x_n\}ℓ(g)∈{1,x1​,⋯,xn​}.
  2. If fanin of ggg is 222, ℓ(g)∈{+,×,−}\ell(g)\in\{+,\times,-\}ℓ(g)∈{+,×,−}.

故意不说人话……就是把多项式分解成多层二元运算。一个多项式就相当于只有一个输出口的算术电路。

Such an arithmetic circuit compute a polynomial p∈R[x1,⋯ ,xn]p\in R[x_1,\cdots,x_n]p∈R[x1​,⋯,xn​] for any Abelian ring RRR. 阿贝尔环

Usually we consider arithmetic circuits w.r.t. ring.

AFIT

aka Arithmetic formula identity testing

A variant of PIT: input polynomial is given by an arithmetic formula.

Instance: Arithmetic formula computing the polynomial P(x1,⋯ ,xn)∈Z[x1,⋯ ,xn]P(x_1,\cdots,x_n)\in\mathbb Z[x_1,\cdots,x_n]P(x1​,⋯,xn​)∈Z[x1​,⋯,xn​].

Question: Is P(x)≡0P(x)\equiv0P(x)≡0?

A simple randomized algorithm: simply choose number a1,⋯ ,an∈{1,2,⋯ ,4m}a_1,\cdots,a_n\in\{1,2,\cdots,4m\}a1​,⋯,an​∈{1,2,⋯,4m} independently and uniformly at random, where mmm is the size of the given formula, evaluate P(a1,⋯ ,an)P(a_1,\cdots, a_n)P(a1​,⋯,an​) and answer accordingly.

Using Schwartz-Zippel lemma to analyze error probability.

🤔Lemma 5 (Schwartz-Zippel lemma). Let F\mathbb FF be a field, let P(x1,⋯ ,xn)∈F[x1,⋯ ,xn]P(x_1,\cdots, x_n)\in\mathbb F[x_1,\cdots,x_n]P(x1​,⋯,xn​)∈F[x1​,⋯,xn​] be a non-zero polynomial of total degree at most ddd. Let S⊆FS\subseteq\mathbb FS⊆F, and pick a1,⋯ ,an∈Sa_1,\cdots, a_n\in Sa1​,⋯,an​∈S independently and uniformly at random. Then

Pr⁡[P(a1,⋯ ,an)=0]≤d∣S∣.\Pr[P(a_1,\cdots,a_n)=0]\le\frac{d}{|S|}.Pr[P(a1​,⋯,an​)=0]≤∣S∣d​.

Proof by induction on nnn.

So the error probability is decided by mmm, at most 1/41/41/4.

🎯Theorem 45. AFIT∈coRPAFIT\in coRPAFIT∈coRP.

没太懂这一部分

Sample from 1,⋯ ,m1,\cdots,m1,⋯,m is equivalent to sample kkk times from 1,⋯ ,2⌈log⁡2m⌉1,\cdots,2^{\lceil\log_2m\rceil}1,⋯,2⌈log2​m⌉. k=ω(log⁡n)k=\omega(\log n)k=ω(logn).

ACIT

aka arithmetic circuit identity testing

Instance: Arithmetic circuit computing the polynomial P(x1,⋯ ,xn)∈Z[x1,⋯ ,xn]P(x_1,\cdots,x_n)\in\mathbb Z[x_1,\cdots,x_n]P(x1​,⋯,xn​)∈Z[x1​,⋯,xn​].

Question: Is P(x)≡0P(x)\equiv0P(x)≡0?

Circuit of size mmm has at most mmm multiplication gates. The degree of the polynomial computed is at most 2m2^m2m. The same approach as in arithmetic formula calls for draw random number from 1,⋯ ,2m+21,\cdots,2^{m+2}1,⋯,2m+2. (exponential!)

To remedy this, we switch to modular arithmetic with randomly chosen prime modulus. Use prime number theorem to analyze error probability.

Let π(x)\pi(x)π(x) be the number of prime number less than xxx. By prime number theory,

π(x)∼xln⁡x.\pi(x)\sim\frac{x}{\ln x}.π(x)∼lnxx​.

🤔Lemma 6. For all m>1m>1m>1, we have π(2m)≥2mm\pi(2^m)\ge\frac{2^m}{m}π(2m)≥m2m​.

🤔🎯Theorem 35. ACIT∈coRPACIT\in coRPACIT∈coRP.

Det kan jeg ikke forstår

An Alternative Characterization of Time Bounded Classes

We have alternative characterization of BPPBPPBPP. Also there are similar alternatives of ZPPZPPZPP and RPRPRP.

Proposition 4. Let LLL be a language. Then L∈BPPL\in BPPL∈BPP iff there is a polynomial qqq and another language L′∈PL'\in PL′∈P s.t. ∀x\forall x∀x:

x∈L⇒Pr⁡y∈{0,1}q(∣x∣)[⟨x,y⟩∈L′]≥34x∉L⇒Pr⁡y∈{0,1}q(∣x∣)[⟨x,y⟩∉L′]≥34x\in L\Rarr\Pr_{y\in\{0,1\}^{q(|x|)}}[\langle x,y\rangle\in L']\ge\frac{3}{4}\\x\not\in L\Rarr\Pr_{y\in\{0,1\}^{q(|x|)}}[\langle x,y\rangle\not\in L']\ge\frac{3}{4}x∈L⇒y∈{0,1}q(∣x∣)Pr​[⟨x,y⟩∈L′]≥43​x∈L⇒y∈{0,1}q(∣x∣)Pr​[⟨x,y⟩∈L′]≥43​

We say that the randomized computation uses q(∣x∣)q(|x|)q(∣x∣) random bits.

Using success amplification a randomized algorithm using RRR random bits and having error probability less than 1/41/41/4 can be transformed to a randomized algorithm using kRkRkR random bits and having error probability less than exp⁡(−k/8)\exp(-k/8)exp(−k/8) by running kkk trials and taking the majority vote.

Randomized Computation and the Polynomial-time Hierarchy

By definition, RP⊆NPRP\subseteq NPRP⊆NP.

But we don’t know whether BPP⊆NPBPP\subseteq NPBPP⊆NP or NP⊆BPPNP\subseteq BPPNP⊆BPP.

We just guess: BPP=PBPP=PBPP=P thus BPP⊆NPBPP\subseteq NPBPP⊆NP.

But we can prove that BPPBPPBPP is contained in the second level of polynomial-time hierarchy.

🎯Theorem 36. BPP⊆Σ2P∩Π2PBPP\subseteq \Sigma_2^P\cap\Pi_2^PBPP⊆Σ2P​∩Π2P​.

Prove that BPP⊆Σ2PBPP\subseteq\Sigma_2^PBPP⊆Σ2P​. From this also we get BPP⊆Π2PBPP\subseteq\Pi_2^PBPP⊆Π2P​.

  • Let L∈BPPL\in BPPL∈BPP. We have a polynomial q(n)q(n)q(n) and a language L′∈PL'\in PL′∈P s.t. for all xxx we have

    x∈L⇒Pr⁡y∈{0,1}q(∣x∣)[⟨x,y⟩∈L′]≥1−12q(∣x∣),x∉L⇒Pr⁡y∈{0,1}q(∣x∣)[⟨x,y⟩∈L′]<1−12q(∣x∣).x\in L\Rarr\Pr_{y\in\{0,1\}^{q(|x|)}}[\langle x,y\rangle\in L']\ge1-\frac{1}{2q(|x|)},\\x\not\in L\Rarr\Pr_{y\in\{0,1\}^{q(|x|)}}[\langle x,y\rangle\in L']<1-\frac{1}{2q(|x|)}.x∈L⇒y∈{0,1}q(∣x∣)Pr​[⟨x,y⟩∈L′]≥1−2q(∣x∣)1​,x∈L⇒y∈{0,1}q(∣x∣)Pr​[⟨x,y⟩∈L′]<1−2q(∣x∣)1​.

  • Let m=q(∣x∣)m=q(|x|)m=q(∣x∣). For given xxx, we define Sx={y∈{0,1}m∣⟨x,y⟩∈L′}S_x=\{y\in\{0,1\}^m|\langle x,y\rangle\in L'\}Sx​={y∈{0,1}m∣⟨x,y⟩∈L′}. Thus, for all xxx we have

    x∈L⇒∣Sx∣≥(1−12m)2m,x∉L⇒∣Sx∣<12m2m.x\in L\Rarr|S_x|\ge(1-\frac{1}{2m})2^m,\\x\not\in L\Rarr|S_x|<\frac{1}{2m}2^m.x∈L⇒∣Sx​∣≥(1−2m1​)2m,x∈L⇒∣Sx​∣<2m1​2m.

    Claim that x∈Lx\in Lx∈L iff

    ∃u1,⋯ ,um∈{0,1}m∀r∈{0,1}m:⋁i=1m⟨x,ui⊕r⟩∈L′,\exist u_1,\cdots, u_m\in\{0,1\}^m\forall r\in\{0,1\}^m:\\\bigvee_{i=1}^m\langle x,u_i\oplus r\rangle\in L',∃u1​,⋯,um​∈{0,1}m∀r∈{0,1}m:i=1⋁m​⟨x,ui​⊕r⟩∈L′,

    where ui⊕ru_i\oplus rui​⊕r denote the coordinate-wise exclusive-or. 什么是坐标或运算？

  • This shows that L∈Σ2PL\in\Sigma_2^PL∈Σ2P​ since this can be done in polynomial time.

It remains to prove the predicate is equivalent to ⋃i=1mui⊕Sx={0,1}m\bigcup_{i=1}^mu_i\oplus S_x=\{0,1\}^m⋃i=1m​ui​⊕Sx​={0,1}m.

Randomized Computation and Boolean Circuits

Everything that can be computed in polynomial-time by randomized algorithm can also be computed using Boolean circuits.

🎯Theorem 37. (Adleman’s Theorem). BPP⊆P/polyBPP\subseteq P/polyBPP⊆P/poly.
